analyzed: mig phor gnyis kyi rtse mo la rab tu gnas so //
translated: lives at the tip of the eye sockets.

original: gal te yang ltag tshigs pa la 'gro bar byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang ltag tshigs pa la 'gro bar byed na ni /
translated: If it moves to the back of the skull,

original: des bdag khro ba skye bar 'gyur ba'am mi dga' bar yang byed do //
analyzed: des bdag khro ba skye bar 'gyur ba'am mi dga' bar yang byed do //
translated: it will make me angry or unhappy.

original: mgul pa la sha skye ba dang mgul pa la yang grog ma bzhin du zhugs nas dbang phyug tu yang byed do //
analyzed: mgul pa la sha skye ba dang mgul pa la yang grog ma bzhin du zhugs nas dbang phyug tu yang byed do //
translated: When it is in the throat, it causes sores in the throat and also enters the throat like an ant, and it also causes the throat to become paralyzed.

original: gal te yang rang gi gnas na gnas par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang rang gi gnas na gnas par gyur na ni /
translated: If it remains in its own place,

original: des nad de dag rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽des rab myos kyi srin la so sor brtags par gyur nas ro drug la shin tu sred par gyur pa'i srin la so sor rtog par byed do //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: des nad de dag rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro // des rab myos kyi srin la so sor brtags par gyur nas ro drug la shin tu sred par gyur pa'i srin la so sor rtog par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: then those diseases do not occur.

original: skyes bu zhen par byed pa'i srin gyis rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci zhig byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: skyes bu zhen par byed pa'i srin gyis rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci zhig byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: Having examined the madana worm, he then examines the worm that craves the six tastes, wondering, “Where does that worm live, and what does it do when it is in a state of health or when it is unhealthy?”

original: ro drug la zhen cing sred pa zhes bya ba'i srin rnams gang dag kho na la mngon par srid par gyur pa'i ro de dang de dag rnams kho na la bdag kyang dang por 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ro drug la zhen cing sred pa zhes bya ba'i srin rnams gang dag kho na la mngon par srid par gyur pa'i ro de dang de dag rnams kho na la bdag kyang dang por 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: “The worms that are known as ‘addicted to and craving the six tastes’ will first of all crave the tastes that they are addicted to.

original: ro gang dang gang gis rang bzhin la ro drug la mngon par sred pa'i srin rnams 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'i ro de dang de dag rnams la bdag kyang mngon par sred par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro gang dang gang gis rang bzhin la ro drug la mngon par sred pa'i srin rnams 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'i ro de dang de dag rnams la bdag kyang mngon par sred par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: I will not crave the tastes that the worms that are addicted to the six tastes do not crave.

original: yang gang gi tshe bdag tshad rims kyis btab par gyur na ni /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe bdag tshad rims kyis btab par gyur na ni /
translated: “When I am afflicted by a fever,

original: de'i tshe bdag gi srin ches snga bar tshad rims kyis zil gyis mnan par 'gyur @187a *//
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag gi srin ches snga bar tshad rims kyis zil gyis mnan par 'gyur @187a *//
translated: the worms will be overcome by fever first.

original: ro; ;skyon de dag gis bdag zas snying du mi sdug pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro; ;skyon de dag gis bdag zas snying du mi sdug pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of these faults, I will not find food to be appetizing.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will further wonder, ‘What other worms are present in my body and what functions do they perform?’

original: ghu ra ghu ra ka zhes pa'i srin nga'i mig phor gnyis kyi 'og tu gyur pa na rab tu gnas pa yin zhing /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: ghu ra ghu ra ka zhes pa'i srin nga'i mig phor gnyis kyi 'og tu gyur pa na rab tu gnas pa yin zhing / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
translated: It is found below the two eyes.

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa; gal te ghu ra ghu ra ka rab tu khros par gyur na /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa; gal te ghu ra ghu ra ka rab tu khros par gyur na /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or seeing with the divine eye, he will notice, ‘If the ghurugurka worm is disturbed,

original: des bdag gi mgo bo gang du gnas par bya ba byed do //
analyzed: des bdag gi mgo bo gang du gnas par bya ba byed do //
translated: it will cause my head to swell.

original: mig por dang mgul par lhang kyog 'byung ba dang mgrin par 'thog pa dang rlung gis kyang bdag gi mgrin pa'i yul du lhags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig por dang mgul par lhang kyog 'byung ba dang mgrin par 'thog pa dang rlung gis kyang bdag gi mgrin pa'i yul du lhags par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will cause my eyes, throat, and neck to swell, and the wind will also cause swelling in my neck.

original: des bdag la 'chi ba tsam du sdug bsngal skyed par byed do //
analyzed: des bdag la 'chi ba tsam du sdug bsngal skyed par byed do //
translated: It will cause me suffering as if I were dying.

original: ghu ra ghu ra ka'i srin dang mgul pa na gnas pa'i srin rnams thams cad lhan cig tu 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ghu ra ghu ra ka'i srin dang mgul pa na gnas pa'i srin rnams thams cad lhan cig tu 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The ghurugurka worm and all the worms that live in the throat will be in conflict.

original: yang gang gi tshe 'gal bar gyur pa de'i tshe na nad de dag rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe 'gal bar gyur pa de'i tshe na nad de dag rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are in conflict, these diseases will occur.

original: ghu ra ghu ra ka'i srin ni /
analyzed: ghu ra ghu ra ka'i srin ni /
translated: The ghurugurka worm

original: rtag tu mchi la mas g-yogs par 'gyur ba dang / srin 'di dag gi kha dang rkang pa thung bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu mchi la mas g-yogs par 'gyur ba dang / srin 'di dag gi kha dang rkang pa thung bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: They are always covered with mucus, and the mouths and feet of these worms are short.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: Moreover, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body

original: lha'i mig gis des mthong bar gyur pa la /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis des mthong bar gyur pa la /
translated: sees by means of knowledge derived from hearing or through the divine eye

original: ro la rab tu sdang ba zhes bya ba'i srin mgo bo'i mgul ba'i @187b gzhi dang mig phor gnyis la rab tu gnas so //
analyzed: ro la rab tu sdang ba zhes bya ba'i srin mgo bo'i mgul ba'i @187b gzhi dang mig phor gnyis la rab tu gnas so //
translated: that there is a worm called flesh-hating. It lives in the throat of the head and in the eye sockets.

original: des bdag la rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci zhig byed pa yin na /
analyzed: des bdag la rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci zhig byed pa yin na /

original: ro la rab tu sdang ba zhes byas pa'i srin ni /
analyzed: ro la rab tu sdang ba zhes byas pa'i srin ni /
translated: The worm called flesh-hating

original: ro gcig 'dod pa yin gyi /🔽ro lhag ma rnams la ni /
analyzed: ro gcig 'dod pa yin gyi / ro lhag ma rnams la ni /

original: rab tu sdang ba yin no //
analyzed: rab tu sdang ba yin no //

original: de yang na mngar ba 'dod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: de yang na mngar ba 'dod par gyur na ni /

analyzed: ro lhag ma rnams la rab tu sdang bar 'gyur ro //

original: de yang na skyur ba 'dod na ni /
analyzed: de yang na skyur ba 'dod na ni /

analyzed: ro lhag ma rnams la sdang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: he will hate the other tastes.

original: de yang na tsha ba 'dod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: de yang na tsha ba 'dod par gyur na ni /

original: ro lhag ma rnams la rab tu sdang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro lhag ma rnams la rab tu sdang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will hate the other tastes.

original: de yang na lan tshva 'dod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: de yang na lan tshva 'dod par gyur na ni /

original: ro lhag ma rnams la rab tu sdang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro lhag ma rnams la rab tu sdang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will hate the other tastes.

original: de yang na kha ba 'dod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: de yang na kha ba 'dod par gyur na ni /
translated: If he desires bitter,

original: ro lhag ma rnams la rab tu sdang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro lhag ma rnams la rab tu sdang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will hate the other tastes.

original: rab tu sdang bar gyur pa'i srin de ro rnams gang dang gang dag mngon par mi 'dod pa de dang de dag rnams nyid nga yang mi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu sdang bar gyur pa'i srin de ro rnams gang dang gang dag mngon par mi 'dod pa de dang de dag rnams nyid nga yang mi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The worm that hates the tastes will not desire the tastes that it hates.

analyzed: ro rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i bdag gi lce'i rtse mo'i sbubs la ro snang ba'i rjes su mthun pas de 'byung ste /
translated: The worm called taste-mover lives in the cavity of my tongue-tip. It is in harmony with the appearance of tastes.

original: bdag gi lce'i rtse mo skam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi lce'i rtse mo skam par 'gyur ro //
translated: It causes my tongue-tip to dry up.

original: bdag gi lce yang de khros par gyur na 'brab gzer du byed pa dang lci bar 'gyur /🔽mgul pa zil gyis gnon par gyur na ni /
analyzed: bdag gi lce yang de khros par gyur na 'brab gzer du byed pa dang lci bar 'gyur / mgul pa zil gyis gnon par gyur na ni /
translated: If the tongue demon is angry, it causes toothaches and a heavy tongue.🔽If it is not angry, it suppresses the throat.

original: ma khros pa yin no //
analyzed: ma khros pa yin no //
translated: If it is angry,🔽the diseases described will occur.

original: khros par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: khros par ma gyur na ni /
translated: If it is not angry,

analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i nad mi 'byung ngo // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na / des thos pa las byung ba'i @188a *// shes rab bam /
translated: the diseases described will not occur.

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa ni /🔽nyal ba la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i nga'i srin ni /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa ni / nyal ba la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i nga'i srin ni /
translated: Moreover, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body sees with wisdom derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye:

original: phra bar gyur pa nyi zer gyi rdul gyi tshad tsam yin no //
analyzed: phra bar gyur pa nyi zer gyi rdul gyi tshad tsam yin no //

original: thams cad kyis ma zhugs pa gang yin pa'i rgyun rnams su de mngon par rgyug par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyis ma zhugs pa gang yin pa'i rgyun rnams su de mngon par rgyug par byed pa yin te /

original: gnad dang lha ba'i gseb rnams dang sha'i gong bu'i gseb rnams dang mgo bo'i klad phor gyi gseb rnams dang 'gram pa'i rus pa'i gseb rnams dang so'i rtsi ba'i gseb rnams dang mgul ba'i gseb rnams dang mgrin pa'i sbu gu'i gseb rnams dang rna ba'i gseb rnams dang
analyzed: gnad dang lha ba'i gseb rnams dang sha'i gong bu'i gseb rnams dang mgo bo'i klad phor gyi gseb rnams dang 'gram pa'i rus pa'i gseb rnams dang so'i rtsi ba'i gseb rnams dang mgul ba'i gseb rnams dang mgrin pa'i sbu gu'i gseb rnams dang rna ba'i gseb rnams dang
translated: It moves like the wind through the joints, the spaces between the bones, the spaces between the lumps of flesh, the spaces in the skull, the spaces in the cheekbones, the spaces in the teeth, the spaces in the throat, the spaces in the gullet, the spaces in the ears,

original: mig gi gseb rnams dang sna'i gseb rnams dang skra dang kha spu'i gseb rnams su rlung bzhin rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: mig gi gseb rnams dang sna'i gseb rnams dang skra dang kha spu'i gseb rnams su rlung bzhin rgyu bar byed do //
translated: the spaces in the eyes, the spaces in the nose, the spaces in the hair of the head and face, and the spaces in the throat.🔽When the worm is happy, it makes the body hair stand on end.

original: nyal ba la dga' ba'i srin de gang gi tshe nyin mo nang par 'gyur ba dang ngal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyal ba la dga' ba'i srin de gang gi tshe nyin mo nang par 'gyur ba dang ngal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: When the worm is unhappy, it makes the body hair fall out.

original: de mtshan mo snying gi rtsa ba la kun tu 'byor par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mtshan mo snying gi rtsa ba la kun tu 'byor par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the worm is angry, it makes the body hair fall out.

original: snying gi padma'i dbyibs de ni /
analyzed: snying gi padma'i dbyibs de ni /

analyzed: nyin mo 'byung ba yin no //

original: mtshan mo ni /
analyzed: mtshan mo ni /

original: 'khum par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khum par 'gyur te /

analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer med pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i tshe na snying la kun tu zhum par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na snying la kun tu zhum par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the heart becomes completely depressed.

original: de la snying gi padma'i dbyibs 'khum par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la snying gi padma'i dbyibs 'khum par 'gyur ro //
translated: The shape of the lotus of the heart contracts.

original: des kyang bdag sred pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang bdag sred pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, one’s craving for self is destroyed.

original: dus gang gi tshe nyal ba la dga' ba'i srin mi brtson par gyur pa na dus de'i tshe rang gi yul rnams la dbang po rnams dub par gyur na ngal bso bar byed do //
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe nyal ba la dga' ba'i srin mi brtson par gyur pa na dus de'i tshe rang gi yul rnams la dbang po rnams dub par gyur na ngal bso bar byed do //
translated: When the worm that delights in sleep is not active, then at that time, the faculties become exhausted with regard to their objects and rest.

original: @188b des srog chags de dag rnams thams cad gnyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @188b des srog chags de dag rnams thams cad gnyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: All those creatures fall asleep.

original: gal te yang nyin mo yang chad par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: gal te yang nyin mo yang chad par 'gyur na'o //
translated: If the day is also cut short,

original: nyal ba la dga' bar 'gyur pa'i srin 'di yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin so sor rtog cing gnas so //
analyzed: nyal ba la dga' bar 'gyur pa'i srin 'di yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin so sor rtog cing gnas so //
translated: one should continue to observe the worm that delights in sleep.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
translated: Again, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body observes,

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dag gis sam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dag gis sam /
translated: “Due to knowledge derived from hearing or through the divine eye,

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa la srin sbom po zhes bya ba nga'i lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa la srin sbom po zhes bya ba nga'i lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: “As I look with my purified divine eye, I see a worm called fat-belly living in my body.

original: mgo bo dang mgrin pa'i yang khrag gi nang du rgyu bar byed pa dang tshil rnams kyi gseb tu rgyu bar byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: mgo bo dang mgrin pa'i yang khrag gi nang du rgyu bar byed pa dang tshil rnams kyi gseb tu rgyu bar byed pa yin pas /
translated: It moves in the blood of my head and neck, and it moves in the fat.

original: de gang dang gang la phra bar gyur nas nga'i khrag rnams 'thung bar byed pa na de dang de dag nyid rnams su lus skrang bar 'gyur ba dang rko rlog tu yang byed de /
analyzed: de gang dang gang la phra bar gyur nas nga'i khrag rnams 'thung bar byed pa na de dang de dag nyid rnams su lus skrang bar 'gyur ba dang rko rlog tu yang byed de /
translated: Wherever it moves, it drinks my blood, and in those places my body swells and becomes inflamed.

original: nga'i kha'i tho yul lam skra'i tho yul lam ltag tshigs kyi yul lam yul gzhan rnams la yang rung ngo //
analyzed: nga'i kha'i tho yul lam skra'i tho yul lam ltag tshigs kyi yul lam yul gzhan rnams la yang rung ngo //
translated: This happens in my mouth, in the roots of my hair, in the joints of my neck, and in other places.

original: gal te yang rgyu bar mi byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu bar mi byed na ni /
translated: If it does not move,

original: rgyus pa'i gseb tu gnas par gyur cing /
analyzed: rgyus pa'i gseb tu gnas par gyur cing /
translated: it remains in the veins.

original: des ji skad du bshad pa'i nad de dang de dag rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ji skad du bshad pa'i nad de dang de dag rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not cause the diseases that it does,

original: gang yang n'a la ti'i grong gi bram ze dang khyim bdag 'di rnams nyid dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dge slong rnams kyang rung ste ji srid du lus la nye bar 'jug pa'i srin bu'i rigs su gyur ba rnams mgrin pa la 'jug pa rnams dang lce la
analyzed: gang yang n'a la ti'i grong gi bram ze dang khyim bdag 'di rnams nyid dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dge slong rnams kyang rung ste ji srid du lus la nye bar 'jug pa'i srin bu'i rigs su gyur ba rnams mgrin pa la 'jug pa rnams dang lce la
translated: The brahmins and householders of Nālada, and also the yogācāra bhikṣus, see, just as it is, the types of worms that enter the body, those that enter the throat,

original: zhugs pa rnams dang ltag tshigs la zhugs pa rnams dang pa spu'i khung bu dang @189a *//
analyzed: zhugs pa rnams dang ltag tshigs la zhugs pa rnams dang pa spu'i khung bu dang @189a *//
translated: those that enter the tongue, those that enter the palate, those that enter the pores of the body,

original: bad kan la zhugs pa rnams dang rus pa la zhugs pa rnams dang khrag gi gseb tu zhugs pa rnams dang rgyus pa'i gseb tu zhugs pa rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo //
analyzed: bad kan la zhugs pa rnams dang rus pa la zhugs pa rnams dang khrag gi gseb tu zhugs pa rnams dang rgyus pa'i gseb tu zhugs pa rnams kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ngo //
translated: those that enter the phlegm, those that enter the bones, those that enter the blood, and those that enter the flesh.

original: rnam par shes par 'gyur ro //🔽lcer gtogs pa rnams ror gyur pa rnams la 'di 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes par 'gyur ro // lcer gtogs pa rnams ror gyur pa rnams la 'di 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They know them.🔽They become free from desire for tastes that are related to the tongue.

original: 'di'i ro la sred pa yang 'byung ba can gyi sred pa rnams rab tu 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i ro la sred pa yang 'byung ba can gyi sred pa rnams rab tu 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: They overcome craving for tastes that arise from craving.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'di ni / sred pa'i kun tu sbyor ba bcings par gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi ro'i rgya mtsho yin pas de dag rnams las 'di 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni / sred pa'i kun tu sbyor ba bcings par gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi ro'i rgya mtsho yin pas de dag rnams las 'di 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: this is the ocean of corpses of beings who are bound by the fetter of craving. They are free from desire.

original: de 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur bas /
analyzed: de 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur bas /
translated: When they are free from desire,

original: de zas su gyur pa'i sred pa dag gis mi 'ching ngo //
analyzed: de zas su gyur pa'i sred pa dag gis mi 'ching ngo //
translated: they are not bound by craving for food.

original: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag rnams kyi khyim bdag rnams kyi khyim dag tu gyur par mi byed cing zhabs 'bring bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag rnams kyi khyim bdag rnams kyi khyim dag tu gyur par mi byed cing zhabs 'bring bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not become the wives of householders who are donors and benefactors. They do not become their servants.

original: nor dang nye bar mkho ba rnams rab tu phal che ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nor dang nye bar mkho ba rnams rab tu phal che ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not have a lot of wealth and possessions.

original: nas sran gyi thug pa tsam gyi zas kyis kyang chog shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nas sran gyi thug pa tsam gyi zas kyis kyang chog shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are satisfied with just a little food, such as a dish of beans.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyus gzhan dag rnams la rab tu zhe sdang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyus gzhan dag rnams la rab tu zhe sdang bar mi byed do //
translated: They do not get angry with others because of gain and honor.

original: tshogs 'dus pa 'du bar byed pa la mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshogs 'dus pa 'du bar byed pa la mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not enjoy gathering crowds.

original: rgyags pa'i gtsug lag khang dang kun dga' ra ba rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyags pa'i gtsug lag khang dang kun dga' ra ba rnams ma yin no //
translated: not the temples and parks of the proud.

original: lus rgyags pas rgyags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus rgyags pas rgyags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The body is not proud.

original: gzugs kyi rgyags pas rgyags pa yin no //🔽@189b gos kyis rgyags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyags pas rgyags pa yin no // @189b gos kyis rgyags pa ma yin no //
translated: It is the pride of form that is proud.🔽It is not the pride of clothes.

original: lhung bzed kyis rgyags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyis rgyags pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the pride of the alms bowl.

original: chos gos kyis rgyags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gos kyis rgyags pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the pride of the Dharma robes.

original: phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge slong yongs su 'dzin pas rgyags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge slong yongs su 'dzin pas rgyags pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the pride of being attended by a monk.

original: grong du 'jug pa'i rgyags pas ma yin no //
analyzed: grong du 'jug pa'i rgyags pas ma yin no //
translated: It is not the pride of entering the village.

original: nye 'brel la lta bas rgyags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye 'brel la lta bas rgyags pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the pride of visiting relatives.

original: gcig pur gyur pa dang 'dod pa la mi brkam pa dang rnyog pa med pa dang sdig pa rnams bcom par gyur pa ni; dge sbyong gi yul la rab tu gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig pur gyur pa dang 'dod pa la mi brkam pa dang rnyog pa med pa dang sdig pa rnams bcom par gyur pa ni; dge sbyong gi yul la rab tu gnas pa yin no //
translated: The ascetic who is alone, who is not greedy for desires, who is free of defilements, and who has destroyed evil, is established in the domain of the ascetic.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' la rab tu gnas so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' la rab tu gnas so //
translated: He is established in the limit of nirvana.

original: de'i phyir na ro'i rgya mtshos gang dag khrid par gyur pa de dag rnams dang gang dag ro'i rgya mtsho la mngon par sred par gyur pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir na ro'i rgya mtshos gang dag khrid par gyur pa de dag rnams dang gang dag ro'i rgya mtsho la mngon par sred par gyur pa rnams ni /
translated: Therefore, those who are led by the ocean of corpses and those who are attached to the ocean of corpses

original: bdud kyi drung na rab tu gnas so //
analyzed: bdud kyi drung na rab tu gnas so //
translated: are in the presence of the demon.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las ring bar gyur nas gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las ring bar gyur nas gnas pa yin no //
translated: They are far from nirvana.

original: de'i phyir na lus la gnas pa'i srin rnams bsgoms par gyur nas ro rnams las rnal 'byor spyod pa 'dod chags dang 'bral lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir na lus la gnas pa'i srin rnams bsgoms par gyur nas ro rnams las rnal 'byor spyod pa 'dod chags dang 'bral lo //
translated: Therefore, the practitioner who has contemplated the worms that live in the body becomes free from attachment to corpses.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba des zas kyis kun tu 'khrid pa ma yin no //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas nas rgyab la so sor rtog par byed pa na des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhin du mthong bar
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba des zas kyis kun tu 'khrid pa ma yin no // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas nas rgyab la so sor rtog par byed pa na des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhin du mthong bar
translated: The one who is free from attachment is not led by food.

original: gyur pa / rgyab tu gyur pa'i rus pa rnams ni /
analyzed: gyur pa / rgyab tu gyur pa'i rus pa rnams ni /
translated: “Again, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body and sees with wisdom derived from hearing or with the divine eye, as it is, the bones of the back,

original: lnga bcu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: forty-five.

original: brang gi ni /
analyzed: brang gi ni /
translated: In the chest,

original: bcu bzhi'o // 'dus pa'i bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bcu bzhi'o // 'dus pa'i bcu gnyis so //
translated: there are fourteen.

original: logs gcig la ni /
analyzed: logs gcig la ni /
translated: In one side,

original: bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bcu gnyis so //
translated: there are twelve.

original: logs gcig la ji @190a *//
analyzed: logs gcig la ji @190a *//
translated: In the other side,🔽there are also twelve.🔽In the back,

original: tsam pa gnyis pa yang de tsam kho na'o //🔽thang ba'ang ji tsam pa de tsam ste /🔽rus pa'i gong bu rnams slar yang rus pa'i phung po'i lus su byas nas nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: tsam pa gnyis pa yang de tsam kho na'o // thang ba'ang ji tsam pa de tsam ste / rus pa'i gong bu rnams slar yang rus pa'i phung po'i lus su byas nas nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: there are also twelve.🔽The skeleton is again formed into the body, and he views the body as a whole.

original: mgrin pa nas bzung nas ji srid 'phongs kyi bar du so sor rtog par byed de /
analyzed: mgrin pa nas bzung nas ji srid 'phongs kyi bar du so sor rtog par byed de /
translated: He discerns the neck and the rest of the body up to the buttocks.

original: sha'i dum bu ji tsam zhig yod pa yin na /
analyzed: sha'i dum bu ji tsam zhig yod pa yin na /
translated: How much flesh is there?

original: ngos gcig la ji tsam pa gnyis pa la'ang de tsam yin no //
analyzed: ngos gcig la ji tsam pa gnyis pa la'ang de tsam yin no //
translated: In one side, there is so much; in the other side, there is also so much.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Again, the practitioner observes the body as a whole,

original: de dag rnams rgyus pa ji snyed cig sbrel ba yin na mgrin pa nas bzung nas ji srid mjug ma'i bar du thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: de dag rnams rgyus pa ji snyed cig sbrel ba yin na mgrin pa nas bzung nas ji srid mjug ma'i bar du thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
translated: If all these sinews were to be joined together, from the neck up to the end of the tail, they would be as long as the height of three hundred yojanas.

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: The wise see this with wisdom born of hearing or with the divine eye.

original: bdag gi rgyus pas sbrel ba rnams ni /
analyzed: bdag gi rgyus pas sbrel ba rnams ni /
translated: The sinews that connect my body

original: mgrin pa nas mjug ma'i bar du ngos gcig la brgya /
analyzed: mgrin pa nas mjug ma'i bar du ngos gcig la brgya /
translated: are one hundred on one side of the neck up to the tail,

original: ngos gzhan la yang brgya nyid yin te /🔽rgyus pa phra mo rnams ni /
analyzed: ngos gzhan la yang brgya nyid yin te / rgyus pa phra mo rnams ni /
translated: and one hundred on the other side.

original: ma gtogs so //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: ma gtogs so // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: The fine sinews are not counted.

original: bdag gis tshil gyi tshad ji tsam zhig yin zhes mgrin pa la sogs mjug ma'i par du des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gis tshil gyi tshad ji tsam zhig yin zhes mgrin pa la sogs mjug ma'i par du des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
translated: “Again, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body sees with wisdom born of hearing or with the divine eye that the fat in the body, from the neck up to the end of the tail, is the size of a small pot.

original: zas bsod pa'i dbang gis tshil rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas bsod pa'i dbang gis tshil rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to the quality of the food, the fat increases.

original: 'grib pa yang ste bdag gi rnam pa thams cad byas pa la yang ma ga dha'i srang @190b lnga yin no //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
analyzed: 'grib pa yang ste bdag gi rnam pa thams cad byas pa la yang ma ga dha'i srang @190b lnga yin no // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
translated: and when it decreases, it is five Māgadha māṣas.

original: nga'i lus kyi chu'i tshad ni /🔽ji tsam yin zhes des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: nga'i lus kyi chu'i tshad ni / ji tsam yin zhes des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
translated: Moreover, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: sees with wisdom derived from hearing, or else sees with the divine eye,

original: rang gi snyim pa'i tshad kyi nga'i chu ni /🔽snyim pa dag bcu yin no //
analyzed: rang gi snyim pa'i tshad kyi nga'i chu ni / snyim pa dag bcu yin no //
translated: “What is the amount of water in my body?”

original: de 'jim par gyur pa'i sgo ni /
analyzed: de 'jim par gyur pa'i sgo ni /
translated: He sees that there are ten full handfuls of water in the body.🔽The openings of the earth element

original: ba spu'i khung bu rnams so //
analyzed: ba spu'i khung bu rnams so //
translated: are the pores of the body.

original: rdul du grags pa rnams ni /
analyzed: rdul du grags pa rnams ni /
translated: The particles of the earth element

original: lus kyi pa spu'i sgo nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi pa spu'i sgo nas 'byung ngo //
translated: come out through the pores of the body.

original: chu ser du grags pa rnams ni /
analyzed: chu ser du grags pa rnams ni /
translated: The particles of the water element

original: rma'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rma'i sgo nas so //
translated: come out through wounds.

original: mya ngan skyes pa'i dus na ni /
analyzed: mya ngan skyes pa'i dus na ni /
translated: When one is sad,

original: mig ngag nas mchi ma 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig ngag nas mchi ma 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: tears come out of the eyes.

original: sa gzhi la rgyu ba'i srog chags rnams nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa gzhi la rgyu ba'i srog chags rnams nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The creatures that live in the earth are harmed.

original: de ni / nga'i rlan gyis zas rnams yongs su smin par gyur pa'i khu ba rnams 'phel ba'i rdul phra rab gang dag 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni / nga'i rlan gyis zas rnams yongs su smin par gyur pa'i khu ba rnams 'phel ba'i rdul phra rab gang dag 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The moisture from my food and drink increases the particles that give rise to the juices that fully ripen my food.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /🔽nga'i bshang ba'i tshad ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te / nga'i bshang ba'i tshad ni /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will also wonder, ‘What is the measure of my feces?

original: ji tsam yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: ji tsam yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
translated: What is the measure of my urine?

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: ’ With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,

original: bdag nyid kyi snyim pa bdun ni /🔽bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi snyim pa bdun ni / bshad pa yin la /
translated: ‘My feces are seven palm-tree measures

original: drug ni / bad kan yin no //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: drug ni / bad kan yin no // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: and my phlegm is six.

original: nga'i mkhris pa dang gcin gyi tshad kyang ji tsam yin na /
analyzed: nga'i mkhris pa dang gcin gyi tshad kyang ji tsam yin na /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will also wonder, ‘What is the measure of my bile and urine?

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /🔽mkhris pa ni /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa / mkhris pa ni /
translated: ’ With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,

original: snyim pa lnga yin la /
analyzed: snyim pa lnga yin la /
translated: ‘My bile is five palm-tree measures🔽and my urine is four.’

original: bzhi ni / gcin yin te /🔽'phel ba dang @191a *//
analyzed: bzhi ni / gcin yin te / 'phel ba dang @191a *//
translated: The fourth is urine.

original: 'grib par 'gyur ba ni /🔽ma gtogs so //
analyzed: 'grib par 'gyur ba ni / ma gtogs so //
translated: The amount of urine increases and decreases

original: nad med pa dang nad kyis byas pa yang ma gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nad med pa dang nad kyis byas pa yang ma gtogs pa yin no //
translated: except for those who are healthy or sick.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Moreover, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body sees with wisdom arisen from hearing or with the divine eye

original: drod dang khu chu dang stobs kyi tshad ji tsam yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /🔽lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: drod dang khu chu dang stobs kyi tshad ji tsam yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam / lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: that the amount of heat, semen, and strength is as follows.

original: drod ni / snyim pa gnyis so //🔽khu chu ni /🔽gcig go / stobs ni /
analyzed: drod ni / snyim pa gnyis so // khu chu ni / gcig go / stobs ni /
translated: The amount of heat is two handfuls.🔽The amount of semen is one handful.

original: snyim pa gcig go /🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te; bdag gi rlung gi tshad ni /🔽ji tsam zhig yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: snyim pa gcig go / gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te; bdag gi rlung gi tshad ni / ji tsam zhig yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
translated: The amount of strength is one handful.🔽Moreover, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body sees with wisdom arisen from hearing or with the divine eye

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: that the amount of wind in the body is as follows.

original: chung ba'i tshad ni /
analyzed: chung ba'i tshad ni /
translated: The amount of the smallest wind is one-sixteenth of a barley grain.

original: snyim pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: snyim pa gsum yin no //
translated: There are three handfuls.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Moreover, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body

original: zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang myangs pa rnams yang dag par bde bar smin par gyur nas 'tsho bar byed pa'i rtsa rgyun bdag gi lus la ji tsam zhig yod na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang myangs pa rnams yang dag par bde bar smin par gyur nas 'tsho bar byed pa'i rtsa rgyun bdag gi lus la ji tsam zhig yod na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
translated: will ask himself, “How many channels are there in my body that carry the food, drink, and other edibles that I consume and digest well, and thus sustain my life?”

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,

original: rtsa'i rgyun bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: rtsa'i rgyun bcu gsum mo //
translated: he will notice thirteen channels.

original: yur ba'i chu gang gis zhing rgyas par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lus 'di nyid de dag rnams nyid kyis rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: yur ba'i chu gang gis zhing rgyas par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lus 'di nyid de dag rnams nyid kyis rgyas par byed do //
translated: Just as water from a canal irrigates a field, these channels nourish this body.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: srog rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / mthar rgyu @191b ba'i rgyun dang / chu rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / rdul rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / gcin rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / rtug pa rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / dvangs ma rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / khrag rgyu ba'i rgyun dang /
analyzed: srog rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / mthar rgyu @191b ba'i rgyun dang / chu rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / rdul rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / gcin rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / rtug pa rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / dvangs ma rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / khrag rgyu ba'i rgyun dang /
translated: the life-force current, the final current, the water current, the dust current, the urine current, the feces current, the lymph current, the blood current,

original: sha rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / tshil rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / rus pa rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / lha ba rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / khu chu rgyu ba'i rgyun no //
analyzed: sha rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / tshil rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / rus pa rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / lha ba rgyu ba'i rgyun dang / khu chu rgyu ba'i rgyun no //
translated: the flesh current, the fat current, the bone current, the marrow current, and the semen current.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te; rtsa'i rgyun de dag rnams kyis gzhi ci las lus kyi khams gang dag rgyas par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te; rtsa'i rgyun de dag rnams kyis gzhi ci las lus kyi khams gang dag rgyas par byed cing /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will further wonder, ‘What are the bodily elements that are nourished by those currents of channels?’

original: srin rnams kyang bdag gi lus kyi yul phyogs dang yul phyogs rnams la kun tu rgyu ba rnams kyis kyang 'gal ba'am 'tsho bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: srin rnams kyang bdag gi lus kyi yul phyogs dang yul phyogs rnams la kun tu rgyu ba rnams kyis kyang 'gal ba'am 'tsho bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: And the worms that move around in the various parts of my body will also cause me harm or even kill me.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,

original: srog rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: srog rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
translated: he will see that the life-sustaining wind

original: snying gi gzhi las so //🔽mthar rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: snying gi gzhi las so // mthar rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
translated: moves from the heart.🔽The downward wind

original: rtsib logs kyi gzhi las so //
analyzed: rtsib logs kyi gzhi las so //
translated: moves from the ribs.

original: chu rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: chu rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
translated: The water-moving wind

original: long ka dang glo ba dang bad kan rnams kyi gzhi las so //🔽rdul rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: long ka dang glo ba dang bad kan rnams kyi gzhi las so // rdul rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
translated: moves from the lungs, liver, and phlegm.🔽The dust-moving wind

original: spu'i khung bu rnams dang tshil gyi gzhi las so //🔽gcin rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: spu'i khung bu rnams dang tshil gyi gzhi las so // gcin rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
translated: moves from the pores of the body and the fat.🔽The urine-moving wind

original: lgang lpags dang pho mtshan gyi gzhi las so //
analyzed: lgang lpags dang pho mtshan gyi gzhi las so //
translated: moves from the bladder and the penis.

original: rtug pa rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni; pho ba dang tshil khra dang gzhang rnams kyi gzhi las so //
analyzed: rtug pa rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni; pho ba dang tshil khra dang gzhang rnams kyi gzhi las so //
translated: The flow of feces comes from the stomach, the intestines, and the anus.

original: bdag gi dvangs ma rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: bdag gi dvangs ma rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /
translated: The flow of lymph comes from

original: mjing ba'i rtsa bcu dang mchin pa dang snying rnams kyi gzhi las so //🔽khrag rgyu @192a *//
analyzed: mjing ba'i rtsa bcu dang mchin pa dang snying rnams kyi gzhi las so // khrag rgyu @192a *//
translated: the ten channels of the neck, the liver, and the heart.

original: ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /🔽bdag gi mtsher ba dang mchin pa'i gzhi las so //🔽sha rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /🔽pags pa dang chu rgyus kyi gzhi las so //
analyzed: ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni / bdag gi mtsher ba dang mchin pa'i gzhi las so // sha rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni / pags pa dang chu rgyus kyi gzhi las so //
translated: The flow of blood comes from the spleen and the liver.🔽The flow of flesh comes from the skin and the tendons.

original: tshil rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni /🔽mkhal ma dang zhag rnams kyi gzhi las te /🔽gzhug rus kyi gzhi las dang / bdag gi rus pa rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyi gzhi las ni /
analyzed: tshil rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyis ni / mkhal ma dang zhag rnams kyi gzhi las te / gzhug rus kyi gzhi las dang / bdag gi rus pa rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams kyi gzhi las ni /
translated: The flow of fat comes from the kidneys and the marrow.🔽The flow of bones comes from the bones of the back, the ribs, and the skull.

original: logs dang zas kyi gnas dang po dang glo ba rnams las yin la /
analyzed: logs dang zas kyi gnas dang po dang glo ba rnams las yin la /
translated: The flow of marrow comes from the bones of the thighs, the shins, and the arms.

original: lha ba dang khu chu rgyu ba'i rgyun dag gis ni /
analyzed: lha ba dang khu chu rgyu ba'i rgyun dag gis ni /
translated: The flow of urine comes from the bladder and the kidneys.🔽The flow of semen comes from the testicles and the penis.

original: mtshams thams cad dang rus pa rnams kyi gzhi las so //
analyzed: mtshams thams cad dang rus pa rnams kyi gzhi las so //
translated: and the joints and bones.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Moreover, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body

original: bdag gi srin gang dag gis gzhug ma'i yul phyogs nas bzung ba'i thams cad du'ang rtsa'i rgyun gang dag la rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci dag byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: bdag gi srin gang dag gis gzhug ma'i yul phyogs nas bzung ba'i thams cad du'ang rtsa'i rgyun gang dag la rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci dag byed par 'gyur na /
translated: will also ask himself, “What are the worms that live in the area of the small intestine, and what do they do to me, whether in a natural or an unnatural way?”

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,

original: mngal nas skyes par gyur pa'i srin bcu dag gis bdag gi mtsher ba dang mchin pa dag gi gnas su song bar gyur nas nad rnams skyed par byed do //
analyzed: mngal nas skyes par gyur pa'i srin bcu dag gis bdag gi mtsher ba dang mchin pa dag gi gnas su song bar gyur nas nad rnams skyed par byed do //
translated: “There are ten worms that are born from the womb. They go to the place of my spleen and liver and cause disease there.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are the following:

original: srin spu za ba dang 'bigs byed dang dzantu m'anda ra: dang au du ma wa ra: dang kun du 'dzim pa dang spu'i gling dang khrag la rab tu khro ba dang khrag za ba dang rab rab byed pa aam bya kas rnams so //
analyzed: srin spu za ba dang 'bigs byed dang dzantu m'anda ra: dang au du ma wa ra: dang kun du 'dzim pa dang spu'i gling dang khrag la rab tu khro ba dang khrag za ba dang rab rab byed pa aam bya kas rnams so //
translated: the hair-eater, the thorn-eater, the jasmine-eater, the udumbara-eater, the all-scratcher, the hair-island, the blood-enrager, the blood-eater, and the aṃ-bird.

original: srin bu 'di dag rnams ni /
analyzed: srin bu 'di dag rnams ni /
translated: These worms

original: rkang pa med pa dang @192b rang dgar 'jug pa dang rdul phra rab tsam gyi dbyibs dang shin tu phra bar gyur pa dang mig med pa dang za 'phrug gi mtshan nyid dang nad kyi mtshan nyid can yin no //
analyzed: rkang pa med pa dang @192b rang dgar 'jug pa dang rdul phra rab tsam gyi dbyibs dang shin tu phra bar gyur pa dang mig med pa dang za 'phrug gi mtshan nyid dang nad kyi mtshan nyid can yin no //
translated: are legless, move freely, have the shape of a fine particle, are very subtle, are eyeless, have the characteristic of itching, and have the characteristic of disease.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas /🔽nga'i srin re res kyang las re re byed par 'gyur ba rnams /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pas / nga'i srin re res kyang las re re byed par 'gyur ba rnams /
translated: Moreover, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: sees with wisdom derived from hearing or through the divine eye🔽that each of my worms performs a specific function.

original: spu za ba zhes bya ba'i srin rab tu khros par gyur na /🔽smin ma dang mig gnyis kyi'am /
analyzed: spu za ba zhes bya ba'i srin rab tu khros par gyur na / smin ma dang mig gnyis kyi'am /
translated: The worm called hair eater becomes angry🔽and eats the hair of the eyebrows and eyelashes,

original: kha spu dang ba spu la sogs pa rnams za bar byed do //🔽de'i skyon gyis mdzer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha spu dang ba spu la sogs pa rnams za bar byed do // de'i skyon gyis mdzer 'gyur ro //
translated: or the hair of the head and body.🔽This causes boils.

original: de la 'dir 'bigs byed ces bya ba'i srin rab tu khros par gyur na /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'bigs byed ces bya ba'i srin rab tu khros par gyur na /
translated: The worm called piercing becomes angry

original: de khrag rgyu ba'i rgyun du song nas lus thams cad 'khrug par byed do //
analyzed: de khrag rgyu ba'i rgyun du song nas lus thams cad 'khrug par byed do //
translated: and enters the blood vessels, causing the whole body to tremble.

original: dzantu m'anda ra zhes bya ba'i srin des ni /
analyzed: dzantu m'anda ra zhes bya ba'i srin des ni /
translated: The worm called stinking anus

original: khrag rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams dri ngan par skyed par byed /
analyzed: khrag rgyu ba'i rgyun rnams dri ngan par skyed par byed /
translated: causes the blood vessels to produce a bad smell.

original: kha dang sna bug gnyis su au dum wa ra zhes bya ba'i srin gyis te /
analyzed: kha dang sna bug gnyis su au dum wa ra zhes bya ba'i srin gyis te /
translated: The worm called udumbara is in the mouth and nose.

original: de ni / khrag gi srin yin pas de khrag la rab tu khro zhing rnam par sdang bas 'brum bu dang 'brum bu phra mo dang skel phol du byed do //
analyzed: de ni / khrag gi srin yin pas de khrag la rab tu khro zhing rnam par sdang bas 'brum bu dang 'brum bu phra mo dang skel phol du byed do //
translated: Since it is a blood worm, it becomes angry and hostile toward the blood, causing boils, small pox, and measles.

original: kun tu 'dzim byed ces bya ba'i srin de ni /
analyzed: kun tu 'dzim byed ces bya ba'i srin de ni /
translated: The worm called all-devouring

original: khrag gi rgyun du rab tu khros par gyur na mchin pa dang khrag dang mkhris pa skyed do //
analyzed: khrag gi rgyun du rab tu khros par gyur na mchin pa dang khrag dang mkhris pa skyed do //
translated: If it becomes very angry in the blood stream, it produces liver, blood, and bile.

original: spu'i gling zhes bya ba'i srin de khrag gi rgyun du song bar gyur nas shin tu khros pas nad 'di dag rnams phul du byed do //
analyzed: spu'i gling zhes bya ba'i srin de khrag gi rgyun du song bar gyur nas shin tu khros pas nad 'di dag rnams phul du byed do //
translated: The worm called hair island, when it moves in the blood stream, causes these illnesses through its great anger.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: g-yan pa dang mig ser dang 'brum bu dang mo bya lang rnams so //🔽khrag la rab tu khro ba zhes bya ba'i @193a *//
analyzed: g-yan pa dang mig ser dang 'brum bu dang mo bya lang rnams so // khrag la rab tu khro ba zhes bya ba'i @193a *//
translated: itching, jaundice, smallpox, and leprosy.

original: srin de khrag gi rgyun du song bar gyur nas nad 'di dag rnams byed do //
analyzed: srin de khrag gi rgyun du song bar gyur nas nad 'di dag rnams byed do //
translated: The worm called very angry in the blood, when it moves in the blood stream, causes these illnesses.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: mdzer gyur ba dang 'dod chags kyi nad gzhan yang bud med la'ang khrag gis g-ya' bar grags pa dang khyem rnams so //
analyzed: mdzer gyur ba dang 'dod chags kyi nad gzhan yang bud med la'ang khrag gis g-ya' bar grags pa dang khyem rnams so //
translated: warts, and other diseases of desire, and also the itching of blood known to women and hemorrhoids.

original: khrag za ba zhes bya ba'i srin de khrag gi nad 'di dag rnams byed do //
analyzed: khrag za ba zhes bya ba'i srin de khrag gi nad 'di dag rnams byed do //
translated: The worm called blood eater causes these illnesses in the blood.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: mgo 'khor ba dang ske 'gul pa dang gzhang smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mgo 'khor ba dang ske 'gul pa dang gzhang smin par byed pa'o //
translated: vertigo, shaking of the neck, and hemorrhoids.

original: rab rib byed pa zhes bya ba'i srin de khrag gi rgyun gyi gseb tu song bar gyur nas nad 'di rnams byed do //
analyzed: rab rib byed pa zhes bya ba'i srin de khrag gi rgyun gyi gseb tu song bar gyur nas nad 'di rnams byed do //
translated: The worm that causes floaters moves through the blood vessels and causes these diseases.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: ngal ba dang rengs pa dang rgyun drag tu 'byung ba dang dngag mi bde ba rnams so //
analyzed: ngal ba dang rengs pa dang rgyun drag tu 'byung ba dang dngag mi bde ba rnams so //
translated: fatigue, stiffness, frequent diarrhea, and discomfort.

original: gang yang de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: gang yang de dag rnams ni /
translated: All of these

original: khrag la rab tu gnas pa'i srin 'khor dang bcas pa rnams thams cad kyis yin no //
analyzed: khrag la rab tu gnas pa'i srin 'khor dang bcas pa rnams thams cad kyis yin no //
translated: are caused by the worms that live in the blood and their retinue.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: “Again, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body

original: srin gyi rigs bcu ni /
analyzed: srin gyi rigs bcu ni /
translated: sees that there are ten types of worms

original: sha la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: sha la gnas pa yin no //
translated: that live in the flesh.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rmas kun nas slong ba dang tsun tsu ra ka: dang rgyus pa sgul ba dang rtsa sgul ba dang pags pa za bar byed pa dang drod sgul ba dang 'phel byed dang dri ngan pa dang rdul la rgyu ba dang rnam par sreg byed rnams so //
analyzed: rmas kun nas slong ba dang tsun tsu ra ka: dang rgyus pa sgul ba dang rtsa sgul ba dang pags pa za bar byed pa dang drod sgul ba dang 'phel byed dang dri ngan pa dang rdul la rgyu ba dang rnam par sreg byed rnams so //
translated: the wound-producing, the cunchukara, the tendon-mover, the vein-mover, the skin-eater, the heat-mover, the increaser, the stinker, the dust-walker, and the burner.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Furthermore, the yogī should carefully observe the body and abide in the inner nature of the body.

original: nga'i sha la gnas pa'i srin gang dag gis rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci byed pa yin na /
analyzed: nga'i sha la gnas pa'i srin gang dag gis rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci byed pa yin na /
translated: What do the worms that live in my flesh do when they are in their natural state or not in their natural state?

original: des thos pa las byung @193b ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /🔽nga'i srin rmas kun nas bslang ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung @193b ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa / nga'i srin rmas kun nas bslang ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,🔽he will see, ‘The worm that causes wounds

original: yul phyogs gang du rma kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i yul phyogs su rmas kun nas bslang bar gyur pa'i srin 'khor mang por gyur nas rma rnams za bar byed pa dang za 'phrug dang rma dag kyang bdag la skyed do //
analyzed: yul phyogs gang du rma kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i yul phyogs su rmas kun nas bslang bar gyur pa'i srin 'khor mang por gyur nas rma rnams za bar byed pa dang za 'phrug dang rma dag kyang bdag la skyed do //
translated: causes wounds in whatever place it is. In that place, many worms that cause wounds will eat the wounds and cause itching and sores.

original: tsun tsu ra ka: zhes bya ba'i nga'i srin gyis kyang rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci byed pa yin na /
analyzed: tsun tsu ra ka: zhes bya ba'i nga'i srin gyis kyang rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci byed pa yin na /
translated: What does the worm called cuṇḍa do when it is in its natural state or not in its natural state?

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dag gis sam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dag gis sam /
translated: This is known through the wisdom derived from hearing.🔽

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /🔽tsun tsu ra ka'i bdag gi srin gal te ltogs par gyur na /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa / tsun tsu ra ka'i bdag gi srin gal te ltogs par gyur na /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will notice:🔽The chuncuraka worm lives in my head.

original: des gnad rnams dang bshang ba dag kyang rab tu 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: des gnad rnams dang bshang ba dag kyang rab tu 'byed par byed do //
translated: If it is hungry, it will break open my vital points and my excrement.

original: des mnyam par shin tu 'khru bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des mnyam par shin tu 'khru bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It will cause me to have diarrhea.

original: nga'i me drod nyams par byed do //
analyzed: nga'i me drod nyams par byed do //
translated: It will destroy my digestive heat.

original: des bdag gi kha skam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bdag gi kha skam par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will cause my mouth to dry up.

original: bdag gi lus rnying bar 'gyur ba dang gzer zug dag 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag gi lus rnying bar 'gyur ba dang gzer zug dag 'byung bar byed do //
translated: It will cause my body to age and will bring on pain.

original: bdag gi bshang ba dang chu 'dres par byed de /
analyzed: bdag gi bshang ba dang chu 'dres par byed de /
translated: It will cause my excrement to mix with urine.

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mor yang gnyid 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mor yang gnyid 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: I will not be able to sleep either by day or by night.

original: srin tsun tsu ra kas ni /
analyzed: srin tsun tsu ra kas ni /
translated: The chuncuraka worm

original: rtag tu yang bdag gi smin ma'i gnas su bshang ba tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu yang bdag gi smin ma'i gnas su bshang ba tshol bar byed do //
translated: always seeks excrement in my eyebrows.

original: de bdag gi rtug pa'i gter la brten nas rlung dang rdul dang gcin dang bad kan rnams dang lhan cig 'grogs par gyur pa'i shin tu 'khru bar byed do //
analyzed: de bdag gi rtug pa'i gter la brten nas rlung dang rdul dang gcin dang bad kan rnams dang lhan cig 'grogs par gyur pa'i shin tu 'khru bar byed do //
translated: “This worm, based on my feces, moves together with wind, dust, urine, and phlegm. It makes me very sick.

original: des bdag gi dang ga mi bde ba skyed par 'gyur zhing lkug par yang byed do //
analyzed: des bdag gi dang ga mi bde ba skyed par 'gyur zhing lkug par yang byed do //
translated: It causes me to lose my appetite and to become mute.

original: gal te mya ngan byed par @194a *//
analyzed: gal te mya ngan byed par @194a *//
translated: If I become sad,

original: gyur na / des nga'i srin tsun tsu ra ka: shin tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyur na / des nga'i srin tsun tsu ra ka: shin tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: this worm, the cuṇḍacūṣaka, becomes very happy.

original: de shin tu yang bdag la stobs dang ldan par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de shin tu yang bdag la stobs dang ldan par 'gyur zhing /
translated: It becomes very strong in me

original: mnyam zhing shin tu rgya che bar khrag tu gyur pa'i rtsa rnams sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: mnyam zhing shin tu rgya che bar khrag tu gyur pa'i rtsa rnams sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: and it destroys the veins that are equal and very extensive.

original: des nga shin tu'ang 'khru bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nga shin tu'ang 'khru bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It makes me very sick.

original: bad kan be'u snabs shin tu 'khrus pas rlung lhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bad kan be'u snabs shin tu 'khrus pas rlung lhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phlegm and mucus make me very sick, and the wind becomes excessive.

original: tsun tsu ra ka'i srin la so sor brtags pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tsun tsu ra ka'i srin la so sor brtags pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus rab tu shes so //
translated: Having examined the cuṇḍacūṣaka worm, he has correct knowledge of the body.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na; des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dag gis sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na; des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dag gis sam /
translated: “Moreover, when the spiritual practitioner carefully considers and attends to the internal body, he will apply insight derived from hearing or see with the divine eye.

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: He will then notice,

original: nga'i srin rgyus pa sgul ba zhes bya ba rtag tu rgyus pa sbom pa'am phra ba rnams kyi'ang gseb tu rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: nga'i srin rgyus pa sgul ba zhes bya ba rtag tu rgyus pa sbom pa'am phra ba rnams kyi'ang gseb tu rgyu bar byed do //
translated: ‘The sinew called the mover of sinews always moves through the thick and thin sinews.

original: de bdag la khros par gyur na des nga'i rgyus pa rnams na bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bdag la khros par gyur na des nga'i rgyus pa rnams na bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is angry with me, it will cause my sinews to ache.

original: gal te ltogs par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te ltogs par ma gyur na ni /
translated: If it is not hungry,

original: des nga'i rgyus par gyur pa rnams na bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nga'i rgyus par gyur pa rnams na bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it will not cause my sinews to ache.

original: bdag gi rgyus pas sbrel bar gyur pa'i rus pa'i sgal tshigs rnams thams cad ma lus pa nas thug tu mthong bar gyur pas des bdag gi lus la rgyus pa las gyur pa'i tshor ba rnams skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bdag gi rgyus pas sbrel bar gyur pa'i rus pa'i sgal tshigs rnams thams cad ma lus pa nas thug tu mthong bar gyur pas des bdag gi lus la rgyus pa las gyur pa'i tshor ba rnams skyed par byed do //
translated: I see that all the vertebrae of my skeleton are connected by sinews, and thus they give rise to sensations in my body that are related to the sinews.’

original: ngas zas dang bral bar gyur pas gal te nang ltogs par gyur na /
analyzed: ngas zas dang bral bar gyur pas gal te nang ltogs par gyur na /
translated: If I become hungry,

original: de bdag gi rgyus pa la gnas pa'i khrag rnams 'thung bar byed do //
analyzed: de bdag gi rgyus pa la gnas pa'i khrag rnams 'thung bar byed do //
translated: he will drink the blood that is in my sinews.

original: @194b des nga'i rtsol ba rab tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @194b des nga'i rtsol ba rab tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: That will cause my exertion to decline.

original: gal te sha za bar byed na des bad kan smug po nga la skyed do //
analyzed: gal te sha za bar byed na des bad kan smug po nga la skyed do //
translated: If he eats my flesh, it will cause me to develop phlegm and bile.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will,

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: with insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,

original: rtsa sgul ba zhes bya ba'i srin de nga'i rtsa kun thams cad kyi mthar rgyu zhing gseb tu rgyu bar byed pa phra bar gyur pas shin tu thogs pa med par 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: rtsa sgul ba zhes bya ba'i srin de nga'i rtsa kun thams cad kyi mthar rgyu zhing gseb tu rgyu bar byed pa phra bar gyur pas shin tu thogs pa med par 'gro ba yin no //
translated: see that the sinew-mover worm moves through all my sinews and travels through the spaces between them. It is very thin and moves without obstruction.

original: de gal te nga'i zas rnams kyi stobs kyis rtsa rnams 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: de gal te nga'i zas rnams kyi stobs kyis rtsa rnams 'joms par byed do //
translated: If the power of my food is such that it destroys my sinews,

original: des bdag gi lus po kun tu skam par 'gyur ba'am yi ga mi bde bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bdag gi lus po kun tu skam par 'gyur ba'am yi ga mi bde bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It dries up my entire body or causes indigestion.

original: gal te yang chu rgyu ba'i rtsa rnams la gnod pa byed par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang chu rgyu ba'i rtsa rnams la gnod pa byed par gyur na /
translated: If it harms the channels that carry water,

original: des nga'i rkan skam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nga'i rkan skam par 'gyur ro //
translated: it dries up my palate.

original: gal te yang rdul rgyu ba'i rtsa rnams la gnod pa byed par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang rdul rgyu ba'i rtsa rnams la gnod pa byed par gyur na /
translated: If it harms the channels that carry dust,

original: des kyang nga'i ba spu'i khung bu rnams nas rdul kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang nga'i ba spu'i khung bu rnams nas rdul kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it causes dust to appear in all my pores.🔽If it enters the channels that carry urine and causes them to be impure,

original: yang gal te chu ngan rgyu ba'i rtsa rnams kyi gseb tu song bar gyur nas sun 'byin par byed na gcin sdom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gal te chu ngan rgyu ba'i rtsa rnams kyi gseb tu song bar gyur nas sun 'byin par byed na gcin sdom par 'gyur ro //
translated: it causes retention of urine.

original: khu chu sun 'don par byed na'ang shin tu sdug bsngal mi zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu chu sun 'don par byed na'ang shin tu sdug bsngal mi zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it causes the semen to be impure, it causes unbearable suffering.

original: gal te yang rtug pa rgyu ba'i rtsa rnams kyi nang dag tu rgyu bar byed cing khros par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang rtug pa rgyu ba'i rtsa rnams kyi nang dag tu rgyu bar byed cing khros par gyur na ni /
translated: If it moves in the channels that carry feces and becomes angry,🔽it causes constipation.

original: des bdag gi rtug pa'i gnas rnams sdom pas 'chi ba tsam gyi sdug bsngal byed do //
analyzed: des bdag gi rtug pa'i gnas rnams sdom pas 'chi ba tsam gyi sdug bsngal byed do //
translated: It causes suffering at the time of death by constricting the lower orifices.

original: rtsa sgul bar byed pa'i srin de la so sor brtags par gyur na @195a *//
analyzed: rtsa sgul bar byed pa'i srin de la so sor brtags par gyur na @195a *//
translated: He discerns the worm that moves the channels:

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor shes so //
translated: He understands correctly and distinctly.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
translated: “Again, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: and who possesses knowledge derived from hearing

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: or sees with the divine eye

original: pags pa skyod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i srin pags pa drug gi gseb na gnas pa rnams gal te nga'i zas kyi skyon gyis khros par gyur na ni /
analyzed: pags pa skyod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i srin pags pa drug gi gseb na gnas pa rnams gal te nga'i zas kyi skyon gyis khros par gyur na ni /
translated: the worm that moves the skin, which lives in the six layers of skin, thinks: ‘If that worm is angered due to a fault in my food,

original: des bdag gi pags pa rnams kha dog ngan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bdag gi pags pa rnams kha dog ngan par 'gyur ro //
translated: it will cause my skin to become discolored.

original: rtsub par gyur pa'am g-yan pa'am pags pa rnams dmar ba nyid dam skya ba nyid dam sngo ba nyid dam rdol bar 'gyur ba'am sen mo dang skra dang kha spu dang ba spu rnams dang skyi rnams nyil bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsub par gyur pa'am g-yan pa'am pags pa rnams dmar ba nyid dam skya ba nyid dam sngo ba nyid dam rdol bar 'gyur ba'am sen mo dang skra dang kha spu dang ba spu rnams dang skyi rnams nyil bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The skin becomes rough, itchy, red, pale, or blue, and cracks open. The nails, hair, body hair, and skin become loose.

original: 'brum bu thug thug po'am mdzer 'gyur ba'am pags pa dang sha dang drod bye bral du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brum bu thug thug po'am mdzer 'gyur ba'am pags pa dang sha dang drod bye bral du 'gyur ro //
translated: The skin, flesh, and blood dry up.

original: des pags pa skyong bar byed pa'i srin rnams la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang lus la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: des pags pa skyong bar byed pa'i srin rnams la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang lus la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: By examining the worms that maintain the skin, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas par gyur pa na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas par gyur pa na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body and observes it will also ask himself, ‘Are there any worms in my body that cause disease and pain, or that are beneficial?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,

original: tshil rgyu bar gyur pa'i rgyun rnams kyi gseb na gnas pa'i tshil sgul ba zhes bya'i srin bdag gi lus la gnas par gyur pa des @195b mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: tshil rgyu bar gyur pa'i rgyun rnams kyi gseb na gnas pa'i tshil sgul ba zhes bya'i srin bdag gi lus la gnas par gyur pa des @195b mthong bar gyur to //
translated: The worm lives in the body’s fat and moves through the channels of the body’s fat.

original: yang de gal te na nyal ba'i skyon gyis sam zas kyi skyon gyis kyang rung ste rab tu 'khrugs par gyur pa skyes na /🔽des nga la 'khru skyug gam 'brum bu'am skya bor snang ba'am thig le'i rigs su gyur pa rnams skyed par byed do //
analyzed: yang de gal te na nyal ba'i skyon gyis sam zas kyi skyon gyis kyang rung ste rab tu 'khrugs par gyur pa skyes na / des nga la 'khru skyug gam 'brum bu'am skya bor snang ba'am thig le'i rigs su gyur pa rnams skyed par byed do //
translated: If the worm is disturbed by sleeping or eating problems,🔽it will cause vomiting, rashes, yellowing, or the appearance of spots.

original: ske la lba bar gyur pa'am rgyus pa'ang rul ba dang stobs zad pa dang lus rjud pa dang bdag zas za bar byed par gyur na rtag tu rdul ba nyid du'ang byed do //
analyzed: ske la lba bar gyur pa'am rgyus pa'ang rul ba dang stobs zad pa dang lus rjud pa dang bdag zas za bar byed par gyur na rtag tu rdul ba nyid du'ang byed do //
translated: If the worm consumes my food, it will cause goiters, rotting tendons, loss of strength, emaciation, and constant salivation.

original: tshil sgul bar byed pa'i srin de la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang lus yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rig go /
analyzed: tshil sgul bar byed pa'i srin de la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang lus yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rig go /
translated: By carefully observing the fat-mover worm, the spiritual practitioner correctly understands the body.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
translated: Furthermore, when yogis and yoginīs carefully observe the internal body,

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
translated: they will apply the wisdom arising from hearing

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: or the divine eye and see:

original: 'phel byed ces bya ba'i srin lus la rab tu gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'phel byed ces bya ba'i srin lus la rab tu gnas pa yin la /
translated: The growth-inducing worm lives in the body.

original: des bdag la rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas par gyur pa cig byed pa  yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
analyzed: des bdag la rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas par gyur pa cig byed pa  yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
translated: If it is in its normal state or not, they will know this through the wisdom arising from hearing or through the divine eye.

original: nga'i srin 'phel byed rnam pa gnyis kyis lus la nye bar longs spyod par byed de /
analyzed: nga'i srin 'phel byed rnam pa gnyis kyis lus la nye bar longs spyod par byed de /
translated: “My growth-inducing worm consumes my body in two ways:

original: zin pa dang ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: zin pa dang ma zin pa'o //
translated: consumed and not consumed.

original: de la zin pa yang lus phyed drod dang khrag dang sha dang rus pa dang lha ba dang mkhris pa dang khu chu'o //
analyzed: de la zin pa yang lus phyed drod dang khrag dang sha dang rus pa dang lha ba dang mkhris pa dang khu chu'o //
translated: The consumed part of the body consists of the half-body, heat, blood, flesh, bones, marrow, bile, and semen.

original: ma zin pa'ang ji ltar lus la skra dang ba spu dang se mo dang kha spu dang so rnams so //🔽nye bar 'phel byed kyi srin des kyang bdag gi lus la rnam pa gnyis su 'phel @196a *//
analyzed: ma zin pa'ang ji ltar lus la skra dang ba spu dang se mo dang kha spu dang so rnams so // nye bar 'phel byed kyi srin des kyang bdag gi lus la rnam pa gnyis su 'phel @196a *//
translated: The same is true of the unapprehended worms.🔽The worms that increase are of two kinds.

original: bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bar byed pa yin te /
translated: They increase my body in two ways.

original: gal te yang nga'i zas kyi skyon gyis 'phel byed kyi srin rnams rab tu rgyas par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang nga'i zas kyi skyon gyis 'phel byed kyi srin rnams rab tu rgyas par ma gyur na ni /
translated: If the worms that increase do not increase due to the fault of my food,

original: des nga spro ba dang rnam par bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nga spro ba dang rnam par bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I will be separated from joy.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la'ang bdag bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la'ang bdag bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: I will be able to move about and come and go with ease.

original: myur zhing brtad par gnyid kyis rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur zhing brtad par gnyid kyis rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I will be able to fall asleep quickly and wake up refreshed.

original: de las kyang bdag gi stobs rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las kyang bdag gi stobs rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: My strength will increase.

original: bdag gi pags pa dang khrag dang tshil dang lha ba dang rus pa dang khu chu dang stobs rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi pags pa dang khrag dang tshil dang lha ba dang rus pa dang khu chu dang stobs rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: My skin, blood, fat, marrow, bones, semen, and strength will all increase.

original: des 'phel byed kyi srin la so sor brtags pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rig go /🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
analyzed: des 'phel byed kyi srin la so sor brtags pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rig go / gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
translated: In this way, examining the stench-maker worm, he develops a correct understanding of it.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will, with insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, also observe,

original: nga'i srin dri ngan pa zhes bya ba sha dang bshang ba dang gcin gyi gseb na gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: nga'i srin dri ngan pa zhes bya ba sha dang bshang ba dang gcin gyi gseb na gnas pa yin la /
translated: ‘The stench-worm lives in my flesh, excrement, and urine.

original: gal te zas kyi skyon gyis khros par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te zas kyi skyon gyis khros par gyur na /
translated: If it is angered by the faults of my food,
