analyzed: de bdag gi gcin gyi sbubs su lhung bar gyur nas gcin dang lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it falls into my urethra, it will be released together with my urine.

original: 'og tu 'gro ba'i srin de la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta bar lus so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: 'og tu 'gro ba'i srin de la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta bar lus so sor rig par byed do //
translated: In this way, examining the downward-moving worm, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba na des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba na des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: Moreover, when yogis and yoginis observe the body as an internal dependent arising, with wisdom derived from hearing or through the divine eye, they see that the body is composed of the four great elements.🔽

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: Moreover, when yogis and yoginis carefully observe the internal body, they will see, with the wisdom derived from hearing or through the divine eye,

original: aoo thidg'a: zhes bya ba'i srin lgang @212a *//
analyzed: aoo thidg'a: zhes bya ba'i srin lgang @212a *//
translated: that the othodhi delight

original: lpags la rab tu gnas so //
analyzed: lpags la rab tu gnas so //
translated: worm lives in the bladder.

original: gang gi tshe gcin gyis bdag gi lgang lpags gang bar gyur na de'i tshe dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcin gyis bdag gi lgang lpags gang bar gyur na de'i tshe dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the bladder is full of urine, the worm is delighted.

original: dga' bar gyur pas kyang gcin gyi stobs kyis khu chu rgyu ba'i gnas gzhi'i skye mched rnams rtsub mor byed de /
analyzed: dga' bar gyur pas kyang gcin gyi stobs kyis khu chu rgyu ba'i gnas gzhi'i skye mched rnams rtsub mor byed de /
translated: When it is delighted, the power of the urine makes the worm’s sense faculties rough.

original: gang la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gang la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: This is how ordinary, childish beings are affected by improper mental activity.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /
translated: Moreover, when yogis and yoginis carefully observe the body, they will see, with the wisdom derived from hearing or through the divine eye,🔽that the othodhi delight🔽worm lives in the bladder.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa kun tu rtogs par dga' ba zhes bya ba'i srin bdag gi lus la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa kun tu rtogs par dga' ba zhes bya ba'i srin bdag gi lus la gnas pa yin te /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will notice that the worm called all-contemplating delight lives in his body.

original: des rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci zhig byed pa yin na /
analyzed: des rang bzhin du gnas pa'am rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ci zhig byed pa yin na /
translated: What does it do, whether in a natural or an unnatural way?

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /🔽lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam / lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or

original: kun tu rtogs pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i bdag gi srin de gal te ltogs par gyur na /
analyzed: kun tu rtogs pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i bdag gi srin de gal te ltogs par gyur na /
translated: by seeing with the divine eye, he will notice that the worm called all-contemplating delight lives in his body.🔽If the worm is hungry,

original: des nga nyal bar gyur pa na dge ba'am mi dge ba rab tu phal che ba rnams bdag gis mthong bar gyur te /
analyzed: des nga nyal bar gyur pa na dge ba'am mi dge ba rab tu phal che ba rnams bdag gis mthong bar gyur te /
translated: he will see many good or bad dreams.

original: de ni / bdag gi srin gyi skyon gyis yin te /
analyzed: de ni / bdag gi srin gyi skyon gyis yin te /
translated: This is due to the fault of the worm.

original: bdag gi yid rgyu ba'i sbubs nas rgyu bar gyur pa'i srin gyi stobs kyis bdag nyal ba na yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi yid rgyu ba'i sbubs nas rgyu bar gyur pa'i srin gyi stobs kyis bdag nyal ba na yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the power of the worm that moves in the channel of the mind, he will also dream while sleeping.

original: de ltar n'a la ti'i grong gi bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dge sbyong rnams kyis kyang lus las gyur pa'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pas /
analyzed: de ltar n'a la ti'i grong gi bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i dge sbyong rnams kyis kyang lus las gyur pa'i dran pa nye bar bzhag pas /
translated: In this way, the brahmins and householders of the town of Nālati and the ascetic yogis

original: lus @212b yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog par byed de /
analyzed: lus @212b yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog par byed de /
translated: will correctly discern the body through the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: ci lus 'di la rtag pa'am ther zug gam yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi bde ba'am gtsang ba'am bdag dang bcas pa'am byed pa pos byin gyis brlabs par gyur pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci lus 'di la rtag pa'am ther zug gam yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi bde ba'am gtsang ba'am bdag dang bcas pa'am byed pa pos byin gyis brlabs par gyur pa yin nam /
translated: They will think, “Is there anything permanent, stable, or unchanging in this body, such as happiness, purity, a self, or something that is blessed by a creator?”

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: With the wisdom that arises from hearing

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: or by seeing with the divine eye,🔽they will see that the body is impermanent, unstable, and subject to change.

original: lus 'di la yang phra ba dang rags par gyur pa'i yang lus kyi rigs su gtogs pa dmigs par 'gyur ba'am gang yang rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug dang yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi bde bar 'gyur ba'am bdag dang bcas par skye ba'am byed🔽pa po rnams kyis byin gyis rlob par byed pa ni /
analyzed: lus 'di la yang phra ba dang rags par gyur pa'i yang lus kyi rigs su gtogs pa dmigs par 'gyur ba'am gang yang rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug dang yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi bde bar 'gyur ba'am bdag dang bcas par skye ba'am byed pa po rnams kyis byin gyis rlob par byed pa ni /
translated: “There is no body that is subtle or gross that can be observed as a type of body, nor is there any permanent, stable, eternal, or unchanging phenomenon that is blissful, or that arises with a self, or that is blessed by the creator.

original: med do // dper na /
analyzed: med do // dper na /
translated: For example,

original: nyi ma mun pa la rag las pa ma dmigs so //
analyzed: nyi ma mun pa la rag las pa ma dmigs so //
translated: the sun is not observed to depend on darkness,

original: phra ba yang ma dmigs so //
analyzed: phra ba yang ma dmigs so //
translated: nor is it observed to be subtle.

original: de bzhin du lus la'ang rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba dang byed pa po dang shes pa po'ang ma dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus la'ang rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba dang byed pa po dang shes pa po'ang ma dmigs so //
translated: In the same way, the body is not observed to be permanent, blissful, pure, a creator, or a knower.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa des nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa des nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa ni /
translated: Thus, when the spiritual practitioner carefully considers and attends to the internal body,

original: bdud kyi drung na gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi drung na gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he will not remain in the presence of Māra,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: and he will reach the transcendence of suffering.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sred pa rnams kyis kyang mi 'ching ngo //
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i sred pa rnams kyis kyang mi 'ching ngo //
translated: He is not bound by craving that is accompanied by the delight and passion of attraction.

original: srid pa'ang 'byung pa can gyi nyon mongs pas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //🔽des de ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas nas /
analyzed: srid pa'ang 'byung pa can gyi nyon mongs pas gnod par mi 'gyur ro // des de ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas nas /
translated: He is not harmed by the afflictions that are the source of existence.

original: gzhan yang nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus de nyid la rnam pa gzhan gyis so sor rtog @213a *//🔽par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus de nyid la rnam pa gzhan gyis so sor rtog @213a *// par byed de /
translated: “ ‘In this way, while observing the body, he will notice that the body is also subject to other aspects of disintegration.🔽He will think, “The body is subject to the disintegration of the wind element.

original: lus su gtogs pa rnams kyi rlung du gyur pa rnams kyi bya ba rnams la yang so sor rtog pa byed de /
analyzed: lus su gtogs pa rnams kyi rlung du gyur pa rnams kyi bya ba rnams la yang so sor rtog pa byed de /
translated: How does the wind element in the body function?🔽How does it function to hold the body together, to move it, to walk, to stand, to bend, and to stretch?

original: ji ltar bdag gi lus rlung gis 'dzin par byed pa dang bya ba byed pa dang 'gro bar byed pa dang gnas par byed pa dang bskum par byed pa dang rkyong bar byed pa rnams kyi bya ba thams cad nus par 'gyur ba yin zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi lus rlung gis 'dzin par byed pa dang bya ba byed pa dang 'gro bar byed pa dang gnas par byed pa dang bskum par byed pa dang rkyong bar byed pa rnams kyi bya ba thams cad nus par 'gyur ba yin zhing /
translated: How does it function to make all these actions possible?

original: bral bar yang rlung gi dbang gis 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: bral bar yang rlung gi dbang gis 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does it function to make the body disintegrate when it is separated from the wind element?’

original: des de ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas par byed pa na /
analyzed: des de ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas par byed pa na /
translated: As he carefully considers the body and attends to it,

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam /
translated: he will apply the wisdom that derives from hearing

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: or see with the divine eye🔽that there is a wind called mouth-based that functions in my body.

original: bdag gi kha la brten par gyur pa'i rlung yin la des bdag la las ci zhig byed par gyur pa yin pa'ang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: bdag gi kha la brten par gyur pa'i rlung yin la des bdag la las ci zhig byed par gyur pa yin pa'ang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: With the wisdom that derives from hearing

original: lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
translated: or with the divine eye, he will then notice,

original: bdag gi kha la brten pa'i rlung gi mthu stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: bdag gi kha la brten pa'i rlung gi mthu stobs kyis ni /
translated: ‘The power of the wind that is based in my mouth

original: rab tu 'phel bar byed de /🔽lag pa dang rkang pa dag dang sen mo rnams kyang 'phel bar byed par 'gyur ro; ;rlung de'i mthu stobs kyis rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyi sems dang po dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu 'phel bar byed de / lag pa dang rkang pa dag dang sen mo rnams kyang 'phel bar byed par 'gyur ro; ;rlung de'i mthu stobs kyis rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyi sems dang po dmigs pa ni /
translated: causes growth.🔽It causes the growth of my hands, feet, and nails.

original: sen mo'i rtse mo rnams la yin no //
analyzed: sen mo'i rtse mo rnams la yin no //
translated: The power of this wind causes the practitioners to focus their minds on the tips of their nails.

original: rlung 'dis ni /
analyzed: rlung 'dis ni /
translated: This wind

original: lus kyis rnam par thar pa'i bsam gtan gyis gnas pa rnams shin tu bde bar yang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyis rnam par thar pa'i bsam gtan gyis gnas pa rnams shin tu bde bar yang byed pa yin no //
translated: and the concentration of physical liberation makes them very happy.

original: de la lhag par gyur pas kyang pags pa dang sen mo dang lag pa dang rkang pa dag lhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la lhag par gyur pas kyang pags pa dang sen mo dang lag pa dang rkang pa dag lhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is excessive, the skin, nails, hands, and feet become excessive.

original: shin tu myur @213b bar skyon par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu myur @213b bar skyon par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They become very thin.

original: kha la brten pa'i rlung yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang lus yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: kha la brten pa'i rlung yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang lus yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: By correctly discerning the wind that is based in the mouth, one correctly understands the body.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “Moreover, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body and correctly discerns it will notice, ‘The wind that is based in the feet is present in my body.🔽What functions does it perform when it is either disturbed or in balance?’

original: lha'i mig gis lta bar byed de /🔽bdag gi rkang pa'i logs la brten nas gnas pa'i rlung des las ci zhig byed pa yin zhing /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis lta bar byed de / bdag gi rkang pa'i logs la brten nas gnas pa'i rlung des las ci zhig byed pa yin zhing /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will notice,🔽‘The wind that is based in the feet is present in my body.

original: bdag gi rkang pa'i logs la'ang ji ltar gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag gi rkang pa'i logs la'ang ji ltar gnas pa yin na /
translated: What does it do when it is either disturbed or in balance?’

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: Through the wisdom arising from hearing, he knows that the gods of the🔽realm of the Thirty-three have a lifespan of one eon.🔽

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will notice that🔽the wind that is located on the soles of my feet🔽causes itching.

original: bdag gi rkang pa'i logs la brten pa'i rlung des ci byed cing ji ltar yang bdag gi rkang pa la gnas na g-yan pa skyed par byed do //🔽g-yan pas byas par gyur pa'i 'brum pa can du bdag gi rkang pa gnyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi rkang pa'i logs la brten pa'i rlung des ci byed cing ji ltar yang bdag gi rkang pa la gnas na g-yan pa skyed par byed do // g-yan pas byas par gyur pa'i 'brum pa can du bdag gi rkang pa gnyis 'gyur ro //
translated: It causes blisters on my feet.

original: bdag lam du 'gro bar gyur na'ang rlung rdol ba'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag lam du 'gro bar gyur na'ang rlung rdol ba'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When I walk, the wind makes a sound.

original: bdag gi rkang pa brtan par gyur pa'ang 'gro ba na rus pa 'khrol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi rkang pa brtan par gyur pa'ang 'gro ba na rus pa 'khrol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when my feet are healthy, the wind causes my bones to creak as I walk.

original: bdag gi rkang pa'i logs la brten pa'i rlung gis mig la mig gi rgyus pas kun nas sbrel ba'i lam nas grang ba dang dro ba rnams dang lhan cig tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag gi rkang pa'i logs la brten pa'i rlung gis mig la mig gi rgyus pas kun nas sbrel ba'i lam nas grang ba dang dro ba rnams dang lhan cig tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: The wind that is located on the soles of my feet moves through the channels that connect the eyes to the tendons.🔽It causes the eyes to become cold or hot,

original: 'di dag bskus par gyur pas kyang bdag gi mig dag tshim par yang byas par yang ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag bskus par gyur pas kyang bdag gi mig dag tshim par yang byas par yang ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and it does not moisten the eyes.

original: des rkang pa'i logs la gnas pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par @214a *//
analyzed: des rkang pa'i logs la gnas pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par @214a *//
translated: He examines the wind that is located on the side of the foot.

original: gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus rab tu rig par byed do //
analyzed: gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus rab tu rig par byed do //
translated: Thus, he has correct knowledge of the body.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully observes the internal body and attends to it will notice,

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: with knowledge derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,🔽that if the wind that causes unconsciousness is disturbed,

original: sems med par byed pa zhes bya ba'i bdag gi rlung nga'i pus mor gtogs pa'i pags par gyur pa la rab rib byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems med par byed pa zhes bya ba'i bdag gi rlung nga'i pus mor gtogs pa'i pags par gyur pa la rab rib byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: it will cause a rash on the skin of the knees.

original: de dang 'gal bar gyur pas ni /
analyzed: de dang 'gal bar gyur pas ni /
translated: If it is disturbed,

original: nga'i pus mo gnyis la grog ma bzhin du mched par byed do //
analyzed: nga'i pus mo gnyis la grog ma bzhin du mched par byed do //
translated: it will spread like ants over the knees.

original: gang gi tshe zug gzer du ma gyur pa de'i tshe rtsa'i gseb tu rgyu bar byed pas rang bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zug gzer du ma gyur pa de'i tshe rtsa'i gseb tu rgyu bar byed pas rang bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
translated: If it is not disturbed, it will flow through the channels and remain in its natural state.

original: bdag la grog ma dang 'dra bar 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag la grog ma dang 'dra bar 'phel bar byed do //
translated: It will spread like ants over the body.

original: des sems med par gyur pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor yang dag par rig par byed do //
analyzed: des sems med par gyur pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor yang dag par rig par byed do //
translated: By examining the winds that cause the mind to become unconscious, he develops a correct understanding of the body, just as it is.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na /🔽bdag gi rlung gang gi las ci dag byed pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa na / bdag gi rlung gang gi las ci dag byed pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “Again, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: will ask himself, ‘What are the functions of the winds in my body?’ With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,🔽he will notice,

original: rus pa gcog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung yin te /
analyzed: rus pa gcog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung yin te /
translated: ‘There is a wind called bone-breaker.

original: des las ci zhig byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: des las ci zhig byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: What functions does it perform?🔽With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,

original: lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong ba ni /
translated: he will notice,🔽‘

original: rus @214b pa gcog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung des bdag nyin mo spyod pa'i sar 'gro ba na'am kun dga' ra bar 'gro ba na'am lam du zhugs par gyur pa na'am mngal dub tu zhugs pa na'am gnas par gyur pa na'ang rus pa 'bigs par byed🔽do // lhang kyog skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rus @214b pa gcog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung des bdag nyin mo spyod pa'i sar 'gro ba na'am kun dga' ra bar 'gro ba na'am lam du zhugs par gyur pa na'am mngal dub tu zhugs pa na'am gnas par gyur pa na'ang rus pa 'bigs par byed do // lhang kyog skyed par byed do //
translated: it causes my bones to ache,🔽it causes my bones to be weak,🔽it causes my bones to be brittle,🔽it causes my bones to be crooked,🔽it causes my bones to be twisted,

original: bdag gi mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid rnams kyi rang rang gi yul rnams la rab kyi stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid rnams kyi rang rang gi yul rnams la rab kyi stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It causes the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind to engage with their objects with great strength.

original: zos pa rnams kyang legs par smin par byed do //
analyzed: zos pa rnams kyang legs par smin par byed do //
translated: It also causes food to be properly digested.

original: gang gi tshe 'khrug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe las ci zhig byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'khrug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe las ci zhig byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: What does it do when it is disturbed?

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,

original: lus la gnas par gyur pa'i zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang myangs pa rnams @217b thams cad kyang bdag gis bde bar 'ju bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus la gnas par gyur pa'i zos pa dang 'thungs pa dang 'chos pa dang myangs pa rnams @217b thams cad kyang bdag gis bde bar 'ju bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he will notice that when the wind is disturbed, all the food and drink that is consumed, chewed, or tasted will not be properly digested.

original: lus kyi mdog kyang bzang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi mdog kyang bzang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the complexion of the body will not be good.

original: lto rnam par 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: lto rnam par 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: It causes the stomach to move.

original: spro bar byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas par byed pa na des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: spro bar byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas par byed pa na des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: By investigating the expanding wind, the yogī or yoginī realizes the body as it is in reality.

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: “Again, the spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body and sees with wisdom derived from hearing, or by means of the divine eye,

original: rgyus pa bskyod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i bdag gi rlung de 'khrugs par gyur pa dang ma 'khrugs pa na'ang las ci zhig byed pa yin na /
analyzed: rgyus pa bskyod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i bdag gi rlung de 'khrugs par gyur pa dang ma 'khrugs pa na'ang las ci zhig byed pa yin na /
translated: ‘The ligament-mover wind is in my body. When it is disturbed, what functions does it perform, and what does it do when it is not disturbed?’

original: nyal ba dang sad pa dang dbang po yid gzhan gang dag gi lus la gnas par gyur pa'i bya ba de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dis byed do //
analyzed: nyal ba dang sad pa dang dbang po yid gzhan gang dag gi lus la gnas par gyur pa'i bya ba de dag rnams thams cad kyang 'dis byed do //
translated: ‘When this wind is disturbed, I will be unable to sleep or wake up. It will cause all the activities of the body, the senses, and the mind to cease.

original: rgyus pa dang ldan pa'i rlung gis byin gyis rlob par mi byed na ni /
analyzed: rgyus pa dang ldan pa'i rlung gis byin gyis rlob par mi byed na ni /
translated: If the sinew-moving wind is not disturbed,

original: bdag gi lus 'khrug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'khrug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: my body will not be disturbed.

original: bdag gi lus la tshor bas gzir bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi lus la tshor bas gzir bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: I will not be afflicted by bodily pain.

original: zha bor yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zha bor yang mi 'gyur te /

original: de'i rlung 'khrugs par ma gyur na'o //
analyzed: de'i rlung 'khrugs par ma gyur na'o //
translated: This is because the wind is not disturbed.

original: gal te yang rgyus pa bskyod byed kyi rlung 'khrugs par gyur na ni /🔽nyal ba dang sad pa dang yid gzhan du gyur cing dbang po gzhan la yengs par gyur pa'i bdag gi lus kyi bya ba de dag rnams thams cad ni /
analyzed: gal te yang rgyus pa bskyod byed kyi rlung 'khrugs par gyur na ni / nyal ba dang sad pa dang yid gzhan du gyur cing dbang po gzhan la yengs par gyur pa'i bdag gi lus kyi bya ba de dag rnams thams cad ni /
translated: “If the sinew-moving wind is disturbed,

original: bdag gis brjod par mi nus te /🔽rlung de'i mthu las gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis brjod par mi nus te / rlung de'i mthu las gyur pa yin no //
translated: I will not be able to describe all the activities of my body, whether I am lying down, sitting, standing, walking, sleeping, awake, or distracted, or if my senses are elsewhere.🔽All of that is due to the power of this wind.

original: des rgyus pa bskyod @218a *//
analyzed: des rgyus pa bskyod @218a *//
translated: If the sinew-moving wind is disturbed,

original: byed kyi rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta bar lus so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: byed kyi rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta bar lus so sor rig par byed do //
translated: then through observing the sinew-moving wind one understands the body in accordance with reality.”

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Furthermore, the yogī should carefully observe the body and attend to it internally.

original: bdag gi lus la gnas par gyur pa'i rlung gzhan gang dag gis las ci zhig byed pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la gnas par gyur pa'i rlung gzhan gang dag gis las ci zhig byed pa yin na /
translated: What functions do the other winds that are present in the body perform?

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: seeing with the divine eye,

original: 'gro ba rnam par zlog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnam par zlog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la gnas pa yin na /
translated: he will notice that the wind that prevents movement is present in his body.🔽If it is disturbed, what functions will it perform?

original: 'khrugs par gyur pa na'ang 'khrug par ma gyur na bdag la las ci zhig byed pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: 'khrugs par gyur pa na'ang 'khrug par ma gyur na bdag la las ci zhig byed pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa na /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will notice that

original: lus su gyur pa thams cad kyi lus lam gang yin pa de dag rnams la 'dis gegs byed do //
analyzed: lus su gyur pa thams cad kyi lus lam gang yin pa de dag rnams la 'dis gegs byed do //

original: de rab tu 'khrug par gyur na bdag gi gcin sdom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rab tu 'khrug par gyur na bdag gi gcin sdom par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is disturbed, it will cause retention of urine.

original: bdag la lgang lpags kyi nad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la lgang lpags kyi nad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: bdag la rlig pa'i nad kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag la rlig pa'i nad kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: I will get testicular pain.

original: zas mi 'dod par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas mi 'dod par yang 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mi gtsang bas gsus pa kun tu rgyas par byas pas bdag sdug bsngal bar byas nas chu ngan gyi lam nas 'byin to //
translated: I will suffer from the pain of my intestines being filled with feces, and I will have to expel them through the path of my excrement.

original: bdag gi yan lag dang nying lag rnams thams cad la srin bu rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi yan lag dang nying lag rnams thams cad la srin bu rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I will get worms in all my major and minor body parts.

original: khong pa'i nad kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khong pa'i nad kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I will get stomach pain.

original: @218b bdag gi yan lag dang nying lag rnams thams cad rgyas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @218b bdag gi yan lag dang nying lag rnams thams cad rgyas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: All my major and minor body parts will swell up.

original: bdag gi rtsa sdom par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi rtsa sdom par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: My veins will constrict.

original: gal te 'khrugs par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'khrugs par ma gyur na ni /
translated: If they do not become agitated,

original: des ji skad du bshad pa'i bdag gi nad rnams rab tu zhi bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ji skad du bshad pa'i bdag gi nad rnams rab tu zhi bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will pacify the diseases I have described.

original: des 'gro ba rnam par zlog par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang lus yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rig par byed do //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: des 'gro ba rnam par zlog par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang lus yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rig par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Examining the wind that turns away from going, he has a correct understanding of the body.

original: bdag gi rlung gang zhig 'khrugs par gyur na'ang las ci dag byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: bdag gi rlung gang zhig 'khrugs par gyur na'ang las ci dag byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will also ask himself, ‘When the winds in my body are disturbed, what functions do they perform?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,

original: 'gro ba'i 'brel rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i 'brel rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas te /
translated: ‘The wind that causes distraction in beings is present in my body.

original: de gal te 'khrugs par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de gal te 'khrugs par gyur pa'am /
translated: If it is disturbed,

original: 'khrugs par ma gyur pas bdag la nad ci zhig byed pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrugs par ma gyur pas bdag la nad ci zhig byed pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa ni /
translated: what illnesses might it cause?’ With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then see,🔽“

original: gal te 'brel par 'gro ba dkrugs pa'i rlung 'khrugs par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel par 'gro ba dkrugs pa'i rlung 'khrugs par gyur na /
translated: If the wind that disturbs the joints becomes disturbed,

analyzed: des bdag gis gsus pa la gnas pa'i rlung gi skran byed do //
translated: it causes a tumor of wind in the abdomen.🔽It obstructs the passage of feces, causing distension of the abdomen.

original: rtug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gegs byas pas bdag mtho brtsams par gyur nas lag pa dag gis drud pas rab tu 'khrug pa skyed do /
analyzed: rtug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gegs byas pas bdag mtho brtsams par gyur nas lag pa dag gis drud pas rab tu 'khrug pa skyed do /
translated: When the hands are pulled up, it causes great agitation.

original: khams 'khrugs par gyur pa yang bdag la 'byung ngo //
analyzed: khams 'khrugs par gyur pa yang bdag la 'byung ngo //
translated: It also causes the elements to become disturbed.

original: bdag la mi bzad pa'i gegs byas @219a *//
analyzed: bdag la mi bzad pa'i gegs byas @219a *//
translated: It causes a terrible obstruction.

original: par gyur pas mgo'i nad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par gyur pas mgo'i nad du 'gyur ro //
translated: It causes headaches.

original: bdag gis zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa rnams yang dag par bde bar smin par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa rnams yang dag par bde bar smin par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It causes indigestion of what is eaten, drunk, chewed, and tasted.

original: bdag gi lus la 'brum bu nye bar skye bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi lus la 'brum bu nye bar skye bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It causes the body to break out in rashes.

original: bdag la tshad pa yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag la tshad pa yang 'byung ngo //
translated: It causes fevers.

original: gal te bdag gi 'gro ba'i 'brel rnam par dkrug par byed pa'i rlung 'khrugs par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi 'gro ba'i 'brel rnam par dkrug par byed pa'i rlung 'khrugs par ma gyur na ni /
translated: If the wind that disturbs the joints were not disturbed,

original: de ji skad du bshad pa'i bdag gi nad rnams bdag la rab tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ji skad du bshad pa'i bdag gi nad rnams bdag la rab tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “My illness will not occur as described.”

original: des 'gro ba'i 'brel rnam par dkrug pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: des 'gro ba'i 'brel rnam par dkrug pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par 'gyur ro // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: By examining the wind that disrupts the connections of beings, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis lus la las ci zhig byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis lus la las ci zhig byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will also ask himself, ‘What other functions does wind perform in the body?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong par gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong par gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will notice,

original: spu dang sen mo dang / rtug pa rnams 'byed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: spu dang sen mo dang / rtug pa rnams 'byed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: ‘The wind that separates body hair, nails, and excrement is present in my body.

original: de gal te bdag la 'khrugs par gyur pa dang / 'khrugs par ma gyur pa'ang las ci zhig byed pa yin na /
analyzed: de gal te bdag la 'khrugs par gyur pa dang / 'khrugs par ma gyur pa'ang las ci zhig byed pa yin na /
translated: If it is disturbed, what will happen? If it is not disturbed, what will happen?’

original: gal te bdag gi spu dang / sen mo dang / rtug pa rnams 'byed par byed pa'i rlung bdag gi lus 'khrugs par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi spu dang / sen mo dang / rtug pa rnams 'byed par byed pa'i rlung bdag gi lus 'khrugs par gyur na /
translated: If the wind that separates my body hair, nails, and excrement is disturbed,

original: des bdag gi dbang @219b po rnams mner bar gyur nas ring ba nyid du byed pa yin no //🔽bdag gi kha dang / sna bug dang / rna ba rnams kyi phyed zug gzer gyis gzer bar byed do //
analyzed: des bdag gi dbang @219b po rnams mner bar gyur nas ring ba nyid du byed pa yin no // bdag gi kha dang / sna bug dang / rna ba rnams kyi phyed zug gzer gyis gzer bar byed do //
translated: it will cause my senses to contract and become withdrawn.🔽It will cause half of my mouth, nose, and ears to ache.

original: mig la'ang rab rib tu 'gyur ro; ;bdag gi snas kyang dri 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la'ang rab rib tu 'gyur ro; ;bdag gi snas kyang dri 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It will cause my eyes to become cloudy and my nose to lose its sense of smell.

original: bdag gi kha yang skya bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi kha yang skya bor 'gyur ro //
translated: My mouth will become pale.

original: bdag rang bzhin du gnas par bsdad kyang skyug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag rang bzhin du gnas par bsdad kyang skyug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when I am at rest, I will vomit.

original: bdag gi bsam gtan gyi bde ba la'ang gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi bsam gtan gyi bde ba la'ang gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will harm my bliss of concentration.

original: bdag gi sems kyi rgyun gcig tu gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi sems kyi rgyun gcig tu gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: My mind will not remain in a single state.

original: lus rang bzhin du gyur pa rnams ni /
analyzed: lus rang bzhin du gyur pa rnams ni /
translated: When the body is in its natural state,

original: sems rang bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sems rang bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: the mind will remain in its natural state.

original: lus la ni /
analyzed: lus la ni /
translated: The body is the basis of the mind.

original: phung po lngar brten pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po lngar brten pa yin te /
translated: It is based on the five aggregates.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang rnams so //
translated: They are form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.

original: lus kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams thams cad rig par gyur nas rnal 'byor spyod pa des 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i chos rnams shes par 'gyur ro //🔽des spu dang / sen mo dang / rtug pa rnams 'byed par byed pa'i rlung rig par gyur nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus rig par gyur nas gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: lus kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams thams cad rig par gyur nas rnal 'byor spyod pa des 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i chos rnams shes par 'gyur ro // des spu dang / sen mo dang / rtug pa rnams 'byed par byed pa'i rlung rig par gyur nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus rig par gyur nas gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: When the spiritual practitioner has understood all the formations that follow the body, he will understand the phenomena of increase and decrease.

original: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis lus las gyur ba'i las ci dag byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis lus las gyur ba'i las ci dag byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “When he has understood the wind that separates the body hair, nails, and excrement, he will understand the body correctly as it is. The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will also ask himself, ‘What are the other winds in my body that perform their functions within the body?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar @220a *//
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar @220a *//
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will notice,🔽‘There is a wind in my body called the great life-force.

original: gyur pa; khu chu rnam par rlug byed ces bya ba'i rlung lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /🔽des bdag la las ci zhig byed pa yin pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: gyur pa; khu chu rnam par rlug byed ces bya ba'i rlung lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te / des bdag la las ci zhig byed pa yin pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: The wind that is present in my body is called the semen-discharging wind.🔽What does it do?

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa la /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa la /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will notice,

original: chu'i chu bur 'dra bar khu chu rnam par rlug byed ces bya ba'i bdag gi rlung yod do //
analyzed: chu'i chu bur 'dra bar khu chu rnam par rlug byed ces bya ba'i bdag gi rlung yod do //
translated: ‘The wind called semen-discharging, which is like a water bubble, is present in my body.

original: des bdag gi gcin gyi lam nas rnam par rtog pa ma byas par gyur du zin kyang gcin dang lhan cig tu khu ba rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: des bdag gi gcin gyi lam nas rnam par rtog pa ma byas par gyur du zin kyang gcin dang lhan cig tu khu ba rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro // 'di lta ste /
translated: If it does not act properly, then semen will be released from the urethra together with urine.

original: yungs kar gyi tshang tsam dang / nas tsam du 'thas par byas nas bdag gi lus la 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: yungs kar gyi tshang tsam dang / nas tsam du 'thas par byas nas bdag gi lus la 'bab pa'o //
translated: It will be as thick as mustard seeds or barley seeds and will drip from my body.

original: bshang ba'i gnas kyang des zug gzer du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshang ba'i gnas kyang des zug gzer du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will also cause pain in the anus.

original: de ni / nad dang mtho 'tsham pa'i rigs can yin te /
analyzed: de ni / nad dang mtho 'tsham pa'i rigs can yin te /
translated: It is the type of wind that causes illness and harm.

original: bdag gi sems kyi rgyun gcig tu gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi sems kyi rgyun gcig tu gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It will not allow my mind to remain in a state of concentration.

original: des khu ba rnam par rlug byed kyi rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus rab tu rig par byed do //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: des khu ba rnam par rlug byed kyi rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus rab tu rig par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: He examines the fluid-disperser wind and understands the body’s condition just as it is.

original: bdag gi lus la gnas par gyur pa'i rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa dang mi 'khrug pa na las ci dag byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la gnas par gyur pa'i rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa dang mi 'khrug pa na las ci dag byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will also wonder, ‘What are the functions of the winds that are present in my body, and what do they do when they are disturbed or in balance?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa'i @220b rgan gog tu byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa'i @220b rgan gog tu byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice, ‘The old-age-inducing wind is present in my body.

original: de gang dang gang du bdag la rgyas par 'gyur ba de dang de dag gis bdag gi 'du byed rnams rnying par 'gyur zhing rgan gog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gang dang gang du bdag la rgyas par 'gyur ba de dang de dag gis bdag gi 'du byed rnams rnying par 'gyur zhing rgan gog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Wherever this wind spreads, my body’s formations will become old and decrepit.’

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i gnas rnams la'ang stobs dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i gnas rnams la'ang stobs dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: I will not be strong in any of the places I go or come from.

original: bdag yud tsam zhig nye bar bsdad pas kyang nad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag yud tsam zhig nye bar bsdad pas kyang nad par 'gyur ro //
translated: I will be sick even if I sit for a moment.

original: bdag mal stan gyi gnas su phyin na yang nad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag mal stan gyi gnas su phyin na yang nad par 'gyur ro //
translated: I will be sick even if I go to my bed.

original: yan lag dang nying lag rnams la yang bdag dbang sgyur nus par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag rnams la yang bdag dbang sgyur nus par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: I will not be able to control my major and minor body parts.

original: bdag nyid mang bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid mang bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: I will become bloated.

original: gal te yang bdag gi rgan gog tu byed pa'i rlung 'khrugs par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang bdag gi rgan gog tu byed pa'i rlung 'khrugs par ma gyur na ni /
translated: If my aging-producing wind is not disturbed,🔽then the illnesses that were described will not occur.

original: ji skad du bshad par gyur pa'i nad de dag rnams rab tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro; ;des rgas 'khogs par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad par gyur pa'i nad de dag rnams rab tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro; ;des rgas 'khogs par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //
translated: In this way, examining the aging-producing wind, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will continue to wonder, ‘Are there any other winds in my body? What are they? How do they function?

original: bdag gi lus la gnas pa'i rlung gang dag gis 'khrugs pa dang ma 'khrugs pa'i las ci dag byed pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la gnas pa'i rlung gang dag gis 'khrugs pa dang ma 'khrugs pa'i las ci dag byed pa yin na /
translated: What functions are performed by the vāyus that are present in my body, and what activities do they carry out when they are disturbed or in balance?”

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,

original: lgang lpags rengs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /🔽de 'khrugs @221a *//
analyzed: lgang lpags rengs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te / de 'khrugs @221a *//
translated: “The vāyu called stiffening of the bladder is present in my body.🔽When it is disturbed or in balance, what does it do?”

original: pa dang ma 'khrugs pa na bdag la las ci zhig byed par gyur pa yin pa yang des mthong ba ni /🔽lgang lpags rengs pa zhes bya ba'i rlung de 'khrugs par gyur na; bdag gi yan lag dang nying lag rnams thams cad la'ang 'phro bar byed do //
analyzed: pa dang ma 'khrugs pa na bdag la las ci zhig byed par gyur pa yin pa yang des mthong ba ni / lgang lpags rengs pa zhes bya ba'i rlung de 'khrugs par gyur na; bdag gi yan lag dang nying lag rnams thams cad la'ang 'phro bar byed do //
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,🔽“When the vāyu that stiffens the bladder is disturbed, it causes all my major and minor body parts to stiffen.

original: dbugs rdub par byed pa dang / snying gi nad dang / lgang lpags su gyur pa yang g-yeng bar byed pa dang / bdag gi rtug pa dang / gcin rnams thams cad kyang rengs par byed pa'am /
analyzed: dbugs rdub par byed pa dang / snying gi nad dang / lgang lpags su gyur pa yang g-yeng bar byed pa dang / bdag gi rtug pa dang / gcin rnams thams cad kyang rengs par byed pa'am /
translated: It causes shortness of breath, heart disease, and bladder problems. It causes my feces and urine to stiffen.

original: rengs par mi byed pa'ang rung ste /🔽bdag gi rtug pa bde bar mi thon no //
analyzed: rengs par mi byed pa'ang rung ste / bdag gi rtug pa bde bar mi thon no //
translated: Or it may not be disturbed.🔽If it is not expelled,

original: co 'dri par byed pa dang zug gzer du byed do //
analyzed: co 'dri par byed pa dang zug gzer du byed do //
translated: it causes flatulence and colic.

original: sems kyi rgyun rnam par g-yeng bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun rnam par g-yeng bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: It causes the mind to be distracted.

original: bdag gi rnam par shes pa stobs dang ldan par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi rnam par shes pa stobs dang ldan par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not make the consciousness strong.

original: chos kyi dbang du byas nas sems rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba dang / las la mngon par 'dod pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbang du byas nas sems rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba dang / las la mngon par 'dod pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It does not make the mind clear about the Dharma, nor does it make one long for it.🔽When the body is suffering, one does not long for the Dharma.

original: lus sdug bsngal bar gyur na chos la mngon par 'dod par mi 'gyur ro; ;gal te lgang lpags rengs par byed pa'i rlung mi 'khrugs na ni /
analyzed: lus sdug bsngal bar gyur na chos la mngon par 'dod par mi 'gyur ro; ;gal te lgang lpags rengs par byed pa'i rlung mi 'khrugs na ni /
translated: If the wind that causes the anus to contract is not disturbed,

original: ji skad du bshad par gyur pa'i nad de dag rnams rab tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad par gyur pa'i nad de dag rnams rab tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: these illnesses do not occur.

original: des lgang lpags rengs par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: des lgang lpags rengs par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //
translated: By investigating the wind that causes the anus to contract, the yogi accurately realizes the body.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi @221b lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi @221b lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Furthermore, the yogī who carefully observes the internal body sees the following:

original: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa dang / 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa dang / 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin na /
translated: “What does my wind that is disturbed or not disturbed do?”

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: With insight derived from hearing

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: or through the divine eye one sees:

original: bshang ba skam por byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas te /
analyzed: bshang ba skam por byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas te /
translated: “The wind that dries feces exists in my body.🔽What does it do when disturbed or not disturbed?”

original: de bdag la 'khrugs pa dang / ma 'khrugs pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: de bdag la 'khrugs pa dang / ma 'khrugs pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /

analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa la bdag gi bshang ba kun tu skam par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung gal te 'khrugs par gyur na /
translated: “If the wind that dries feces is disturbed,

original: des bdag gal te rab tu phal che ba'i bza' bar bya ba dang bca' bar bya ba rnams bsod par gyur pa'i 'du shes su byas nas mang du zas skom rnams mid par gyur pa na /
analyzed: des bdag gal te rab tu phal che ba'i bza' bar bya ba dang bca' bar bya ba rnams bsod par gyur pa'i 'du shes su byas nas mang du zas skom rnams mid par gyur pa na /

translated: By examining the constipation-causing wind, the spiritual practitioner correctly understands the body.🔽“The spiritual practitioner who carefully observes the internal body

analyzed: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis las ci zhig byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: will also ask himself, ‘What other functions does wind perform in my body?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,

analyzed: des bdag la 'khrugs par gyur pa dang / 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin pa yang des mthong ba ni /
translated: When it is disturbed or not, what functions does it perform?’
