original: bdag skyes par gyur nas mngal na gnas pa las des bud med dam ma ning du'ang byed do //
analyzed: bdag skyes par gyur nas mngal na gnas pa las des bud med dam ma ning du'ang byed do //
translated: It will also make me a female or a neuter.

original: thams cad du'ang mngal 'pho bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du'ang mngal 'pho bar byed pa yin te /
translated: In all cases, the womb will be destroyed.

original: nyes par byas pa'i las can rnams la'o //
analyzed: nyes par byas pa'i las can rnams la'o //
translated: This is for those who have committed misdeeds.

original: gal te yang mngal 'jig par byed pa'i rlung sngon nyes par byas pa'i las rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan par gyur pas 'khrugs par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang mngal 'jig par byed pa'i rlung sngon nyes par byas pa'i las rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan par gyur pas 'khrugs par ma gyur na ni /
translated: If the wind that destroys the womb is not disturbed due to the condition of previous misdeeds,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i mngal gyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i nad de dag rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i mngal gyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i nad de dag rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The diseases that cause the womb to change in the ways described above will not occur.

original: des mngal 'jig par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus rab tu rig par byed do //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: des mngal 'jig par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus rab tu rig par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: By examining the wind that destroys the womb, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa dang / 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa dang / 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully observes the internal body will continue to wonder, ‘When the winds are disturbed or not disturbed, what functions do they perform?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,🔽he will notice,

original: gal te bdag 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / rgyug pa dang / mchod par byed pa'i rlung 'khrugs pa dang / ma 'khrugs par gyur pa ste; des bdag kyog por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / rgyug pa dang / mchod par byed pa'i rlung 'khrugs pa dang / ma 'khrugs par gyur pa ste; des bdag kyog por 'gyur ro //
translated: ‘If the wind that moves me to come and go, to run and jump, is disturbed or not disturbed, I will become crooked.

original: lag pa dag kyang 'khum par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag pa dag kyang 'khum par 'gyur ro //
translated: The hands also become stiff.

original: sgur por yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgur por yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes hunched over.

original: gnas dang gnas su'ang 'gro bar mi nus so //🔽bdag gi zas dang gnas dang @235a *//
analyzed: gnas dang gnas su'ang 'gro bar mi nus so // bdag gi zas dang gnas dang @235a *//
translated: One is unable to go to one’s favorite places.

original: kun dga' ra ba rnams su'ang 'gro bar mi nus so //
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba rnams su'ang 'gro bar mi nus so //
translated: One is unable to go to one’s favorite places, such as one’s home, garden, or park.

original: bdag gi lus kyi dbang po'i blo rnams dang yid kyang rab tu dang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyi dbang po'i blo rnams dang yid kyang rab tu dang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One’s mind and mental factors do not become clear.

original: gal te 'khrugs par ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'khrugs par ma gyur na ni /
translated: If it is not disturbed,

original: bdag gi lus 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rnams nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'gro ba dang 'ong ba rnams nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: one is able to move one’s body.

original: bdag gis rgyug pa dang / mchong ba dang / 'jog pa rnams kyang nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis rgyug pa dang / mchong ba dang / 'jog pa rnams kyang nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: One is able to run, jump, and sit down.

original: des 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / rgyug pa dang / mchod par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: des 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / rgyug pa dang / mchod par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //
translated: Having examined the wind that moves the body, he has a correct understanding of the body.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Moreover, the yogis and yoginis who practice internal yoga observe the body in the body.

original: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa'am 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa'am 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will also ask himself, ‘When other types of wind are disturbed or not disturbed, what functions do they perform?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: “With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,

original: bdag gi mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus rnams kyi so sor las byed pa'i rlung lnga pa rnams so sor rgyu bar byed do //🔽de la rlung gcig ni /
analyzed: bdag gi mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus rnams kyi so sor las byed pa'i rlung lnga pa rnams so sor rgyu bar byed do // de la rlung gcig ni /
translated: ‘There are five types of wind that individually perform their own functions in relation to my eyes, ears, nose, tongue, and body.

original: mig dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i 'byung ba bzhi las shin tu g-yo bar byed pas na rlung yin te /🔽des na 'di la ni /
analyzed: mig dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i 'byung ba bzhi las shin tu g-yo bar byed pas na rlung yin te / des na 'di la ni /
translated: “ ‘The first of these is the eye-accompanying wind. It is a wind because it is extremely mobile and is formed from the four great elements.🔽Therefore, it is called “wind.”

original: rlung zhes brjod do; ;des gal te bdag gi mig rab tu dang bar byed par gyur na ni /
analyzed: rlung zhes brjod do; ;des gal te bdag gi mig rab tu dang bar byed par gyur na ni /
translated: If it is clear,

original: gang gis bdag gi 'byung ba chen po rnams rab tu dang bar byas pas gzugs rnams lta bar byed pa la nus pa dang @235b ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis bdag gi 'byung ba chen po rnams rab tu dang bar byas pas gzugs rnams lta bar byed pa la nus pa dang @235b ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: “ ‘The wind that is present in my body makes my great elements clear, and thus I am able to see forms.

original: rna ba la yang bdag gi rlung gzhan na rab tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rna ba la yang bdag gi rlung gzhan na rab tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: “ ‘There is another wind in my ears,

original: des sgra rnams 'dzin par byed pa la bdag nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du snas dri rnams 'dzin par byed pa yin te /🔽de ltar snas nus par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des sgra rnams 'dzin par byed pa la bdag nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro // de bzhin du snas dri rnams 'dzin par byed pa yin te / de ltar snas nus par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: and it makes me able to hear sounds.🔽“ ‘In the same way, the wind in my nose makes me able to smell scents.🔽“ ‘In this way, the wind makes me able to smell scents.

original: de ltar bdag gi lces kyang ro rnams myang bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi lces kyang ro rnams myang bar byed pa yin no //
translated: “ ‘In this way, my tongue experiences tastes.

original: de ltar bdag gi lus kyis kyang reg bya rnams 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi lus kyis kyang reg bya rnams 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: “ ‘In this way, my body experiences textures.

original: de ltar yang rlung lnga po rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar yang rlung lnga po rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //
translated: “ ‘In this way, the five winds are correctly experienced in the body.

original: gal te yang rlung de dag rnams kyang 'khrugs par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang rlung de dag rnams kyang 'khrugs par gyur na ni /
translated: “ ‘If those winds become disturbed,

original: ji skad du bshad par gyur pa'i yul de dag rnams la dbang po rnams nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad par gyur pa'i yul de dag rnams la dbang po rnams nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The faculties are rendered powerless with respect to the objects that have been described.

original: des mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus rnams la gnas par gyur pa'i rlung lnga po rnams shes par gyur pa dag gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: des mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus rnams la gnas par gyur pa'i rlung lnga po rnams shes par gyur pa dag gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Through this knowledge of the five types of energies that are located in the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, and body, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag lus la rab tu gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag lus la rab tu gnas pa yin la /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will further wonder, ‘Are there any other energies present in my body?

original: de bdag la 'khrugs par gyur pa'am 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: de bdag la 'khrugs par gyur pa'am 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: If they are disturbed or not, what functions do they perform?

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,

original: grog ma pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas te /
analyzed: grog ma pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas te /
translated: ‘The ant-like energy is present in my body.

original: des 'khrugs pa dang / ma 'khrugs pa na bdag la las ci zhig @236a *//
analyzed: des 'khrugs pa dang / ma 'khrugs pa na bdag la las ci zhig @236a *//
translated: If it is disturbed or not disturbed, what actions will it make me do?

original: byed pa yin pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: byed pa yin pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa ni /
translated: by means of the divine eye, he will see:

original: gal te grog ma pa'i rlung bdag 'chi ba'i dus su gyur pa na shin tu 'khrugs pa skyes par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te grog ma pa'i rlung bdag 'chi ba'i dus su gyur pa na shin tu 'khrugs pa skyes par gyur na ni /
translated: If the ant-like wind is disturbed at the time of death, it will cause great disturbance.

original: des bdag gis pags pa dang / khrag dang / sha dang / tshil dang / rus pa'i 'du shes dang / khu chu yang ste /🔽khams de dag rnams thams cad kyang skam par byed do //🔽kun tu sgul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bdag gis pags pa dang / khrag dang / sha dang / tshil dang / rus pa'i 'du shes dang / khu chu yang ste / khams de dag rnams thams cad kyang skam par byed do // kun tu sgul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It will cause the perception of skin, blood, flesh, fat, bones, and semen🔽to dry up.🔽It will cause the body to shake.

original: 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will cause the body to move.

original: kun tu bskams par gyur nas kyang bdag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe na de ltar tshor ba rnams byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun tu bskams par gyur nas kyang bdag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe na de ltar tshor ba rnams byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it dries up completely, it will cause me to experience death.

original: rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa'i lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi grog ma stong phrag rnams gal te lus la bcug par gyur na yang de'i bcu drug gi char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa'i lcags kyi rang bzhin gyi grog ma stong phrag rnams gal te lus la bcug par gyur na yang de'i bcu drug gi char yang mi phod do //
translated: Even if thousands of ants made of burning iron were to enter my body, it would not be even a sixteenth part of the pain I will experience at the time of death.

original: gal te yang bdag 'chi bar gyur pa'i dus na shin tu stobs che bar 'khrugs par ma gyur na legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis des bdag la shin tu mi bzad pa'i tshor ba rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang bdag 'chi bar gyur pa'i dus na shin tu stobs che bar 'khrugs par ma gyur na legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis des bdag la shin tu mi bzad pa'i tshor ba rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If I die without being disturbed by the most powerful of afflictions, then the nature of my virtuous actions will not cause me to experience extremely terrible feelings.

original: des grog ma par gyur pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: des grog ma par gyur pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: In this way, examining the ant-like wind, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa'am 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa'am 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin na /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will continue to wonder, ‘When the other winds in my body are disturbed or not disturbed, what functions do they perform?’

original: des @236b thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /🔽lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: des @236b thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam / lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: Through the wisdom arising from hearing or🔽through the divine eye one sees that🔽

original: kha ba pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /🔽des 'khrugs pa dang ma 'khrugs pa na bdag la las ci zhig byed pa yin pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bdag gis sam /
analyzed: kha ba pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te / des 'khrugs pa dang ma 'khrugs pa na bdag la las ci zhig byed pa yin pa yang des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bdag gis sam /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will notice that the snow-like wind is present in his body.

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa ni /🔽gal te bdag 'chi bar gyur pa'i dus su kha ba lta bu'i rlung de 'khrugs par gyur na /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa ni / gal te bdag 'chi bar gyur pa'i dus su kha ba lta bu'i rlung de 'khrugs par gyur na /
translated: Wondering what function this wind may have when either disturbed or in balance, he will apply insight derived from hearing or see with the divine eye.🔽He will then notice,

original: des bdag gi lus su gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / tshigs su gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / gnad du gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / rgyus par gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / rgyus pa'i gseb tu gyur pa rnams thams cad dang /
analyzed: des bdag gi lus su gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / tshigs su gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / gnad du gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / rgyus par gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / rgyus pa'i gseb tu gyur pa rnams thams cad dang /
translated: ‘If the snow-like wind is disturbed at the time of my death, it will cause all the parts of my body, all the joints, all the vital points, all the tendons, and all the spaces between the tendons to become stiff.

original: khog par gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / spu'i khung bur gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / sha'i dum bur gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / lha bar gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / rus par gyur pa rnams thams cad la yang rab tu 'bar bar 'gyur zhing khab dang 'dra bar gyur pa rnams kyis lus thams cad la khyab par byed do //
analyzed: khog par gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / spu'i khung bur gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / sha'i dum bur gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / lha bar gyur pa rnams thams cad dang / rus par gyur pa rnams thams cad la yang rab tu 'bar bar 'gyur zhing khab dang 'dra bar gyur pa rnams kyis lus thams cad la khyab par byed do //
translated: The entire body, all the pores, all the pieces of flesh, all the joints, all the bones, are ablaze and pervade the entire body with needles.

original: des de bzhin du bdag la tshor ba rnams byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de bzhin du bdag la tshor ba rnams byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, he experiences sensations.

original: dper na / khab brgya stong phrag mang po rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa rnams lus thams cad la rab tu btsugs par gyur pas kyang bcu drug gi char yang chog par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / khab brgya stong phrag mang po rab tu 'bar bar gyur pa rnams lus thams cad la rab tu btsugs par gyur pas kyang bcu drug gi char yang chog par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, even if many hundreds of thousands of burning needles are inserted into the entire body, it is not even a sixteenth part of the pain.

original: gal te yang sngon legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyi gzi @237a *//
analyzed: gal te yang sngon legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyi gzi @237a *//
translated: If there are powerful former wholesome actions,

original: brjid kyis bdag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe na khab lta bu'i rlung shin tu stobs che bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: brjid kyis bdag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe na khab lta bu'i rlung shin tu stobs che bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: When I die, may the needle-like wind not become extremely powerful.

original: des ji skad du bshad par gyur pa'i tshor ba rnams mi bzad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ji skad du bshad par gyur pa'i tshor ba rnams mi bzad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: May the sensations it causes not be unbearable.

original: des khab lta bu'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /🔽bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa dang 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na lus la las ci zhig byed pa yin na; des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: des khab lta bu'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te / bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa dang 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na lus la las ci zhig byed pa yin na; des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: In this way, examining the needle-like wind, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will also ask himself, ‘When the winds in my body are disturbed or not disturbed, what functions do they perform in the body?’ With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,

analyzed: mkhris pa kun nas sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba'i rlung lus la rab tu gnas te /

analyzed: des 'khrugs par gyur na yang bdag la las ci zhig byed pa yin na /
translated: What does it do when it is disturbed?

translated: With insight derived from hearing or

analyzed: gal te mkhris pa kun nas sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba'i rlung 'khrugs par gyur na /
translated: If the bile-aggravating wind is disturbed,

analyzed: des bdag gi gsus pa na gnas par gyur pa'i mkhris pa sun byung nas kha skam par byed pa yin no //
translated: it will agitate the bile that is located in my abdomen and cause my mouth to become dry.

original: lus thams cad ni /
analyzed: lus thams cad ni /
translated: It will cause my entire body

analyzed: gal te yang bdag gi mkhris pa kun tu sun 'byin par byed pa'i rlung 'khrugs par ma gyur na ni /

analyzed: des mkhris pa kun tu sun 'don par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rtogs par byed do //
translated: In this way, examining the bile-aggravating wind, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,🔽‘The intestine-separator wind is present in my body.

analyzed: bdag gi gzhang yang khro gnyer gsum du sun 'byin par byed la /

analyzed: bshang ba rgyu bar gyur pa'i spubs kun tu sun phyung bar yang gyur cing khu bas kyang bdag la gzhang 'brum bskyed par gyur nas des bdag shin tu yang na tsha bar byed do; ;des yang na khrag gis shin tu yang 'khru bar byed do //

analyzed: des khrag kun tu sun 'don par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: In this way, examining the blood-disturbing wind, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis 'khrugs par gyur pa dang 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na las ci zhig byed pa yin no //🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /

translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will also ask himself, ‘Which other winds are present in my body? What functions do they perform when they are disturbed or in balance?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will then notice,🔽“

analyzed: gal te sha kun nas sun 'don par byed pa'i rlung bdag la rab tu 'khrugs par gyur na /

analyzed: des bdag rtsub pa dang / snum bag can ma yin pa dang / mdog ngan pa dang / hrud hrud po dang / nad chen por gyur pa dang / @241b dri mi zhim pa dang / lus su gyur pa rnams thams cad la yang kab kob tu gyur pa'i thig le rnams skyed do //
translated: it will make me rough, ununctuous, ugly, and very sick, with a bad smell, and it will produce all kinds of spots on my body.

analyzed: kun tu skyes par gyur pa rnams kyang dri mi zhim par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: des sha sun 'don par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta bar lus rnams so sor rig par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas par gyur pa na /

translated: If the hair-making wind is disturbed in my body,🔽it will cause my hair to turn white, even though I am young and in the prime of life.

original: gzhon pa lang tsho la bab par gyur pa yang rdzud pa nyid du skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gzhon pa lang tsho la bab par gyur pa yang rdzud pa nyid du skyed par byed de /
translated: It will make me look old, even though I am young and in the prime of life.

original: de ni / ji ltar rgan po bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni / ji ltar rgan po bzhin no //
translated: I will look like an old man.

original: gal te yang byis pa so so'i skye bo gzhan dag rnams la yang zas kyis skyed par byed do //🔽de dag kyang bu'i rim pa ji lta bas rgan po rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang byis pa so so'i skye bo gzhan dag rnams la yang zas kyis skyed par byed do // de dag kyang bu'i rim pa ji lta bas rgan po rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is disturbed in other young people, it will make their hair white.🔽They will look old, even though they are young.

original: gzhon pa lang tsho la bab par gyur pa de dag rnams kyang nges par yang kun tu 'brel bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhon pa lang tsho la bab par gyur pa de dag rnams kyang nges par yang kun tu 'brel bar byed do //
translated: It will make them look old, even though they are young.

original: de dag rnams kyang gzhan gang dag byis pa rnams la yin pa las de dag kyang rgyun gyi rim pas rgas pa dang shin tu 'brel bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyang gzhan gang dag byis pa rnams la yin pa las de dag kyang rgyun gyi rim pas rgas pa dang shin tu 'brel bar byed do //
translated: These are the same as those of the childish, but they are also connected with old age in the sequence of the continuum.

original: gsar pa lang tsho la bab pa rnams kyang skra dkar por byed pa'i rlung gi mthu stobs kyis gsar pa lang tsho la bab pa rnams kyang rgas pa rab kyi stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsar pa lang tsho la bab pa rnams kyang skra dkar por byed pa'i rlung gi mthu stobs kyis gsar pa lang tsho la bab pa rnams kyang rgas pa rab kyi stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those who are young and in the prime of life become old through the power of the wind that turns the hair white.

original: skra dkar du byed pa'i rlung de yang bzang ldan gyi dus na mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skra dkar du byed pa'i rlung de yang bzang ldan gyi dus na mi 'byung ngo //
translated: This wind that turns the hair white does not occur in the Bhadrakalpa.

original: rtsod ldan gyi dus na yang ji ltar chos ma yin pa la phal cher skye rgu rnams gnas par gyur pa de lta de ltar skra dkar du byed pa'i rlung rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsod ldan gyi dus na yang ji ltar chos ma yin pa la phal cher skye rgu rnams gnas par gyur pa de lta de ltar skra dkar du byed pa'i rlung rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the Kaliyuga, as unrighteousness becomes more and more prevalent among living beings, the wind that turns the hair white becomes stronger and stronger.

original: de ltar yang chos ma yin pa la gnas pa'i sems can rnams phal che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang chos ma yin pa la gnas pa'i sems can rnams phal che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, living beings who are devoted to unrighteousness become more and more numerous.

original: des skra dkar du byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta @244b pa bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: des skra dkar du byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta @244b pa bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Examining the hair-whitening wind, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis las ci zhig byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: bdag gi rlung gzhan gang dag gis las ci zhig byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully observes the internal body will also wonder, ‘What other functions does wind perform in my body?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,

original: mthun pa sun 'don pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa sun 'don pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: he will notice, ‘The harmony-destroyer wind is present in my body.

original: de gal te bdag la 'khrugs par gyur pa dang 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na des bdag la las ci zhig byed pa yin na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: de gal te bdag la 'khrugs par gyur pa dang 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na des bdag la las ci zhig byed pa yin na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: If it is disturbed or not disturbed, what functions will it perform in my body?’

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur ba /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur ba /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye,

original: bdag la 'khrugs par gyur pas ni /
analyzed: bdag la 'khrugs par gyur pas ni /
translated: he will notice, ‘If the harmony-destroyer wind is disturbed,

original: dang ga mi bde bar byed do //
analyzed: dang ga mi bde bar byed do //
translated: and I will feel nauseous.

original: sdug pa dang mthun pa rnams la zhe sdang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug pa dang mthun pa rnams la zhe sdang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I will feel aversion toward what is pleasant and agreeable.

original: de nyin mo nyal ba na 'khrugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyin mo nyal ba na 'khrugs par 'gyur te /
translated: When I lie down during the day, I will feel agitated.

original: zas mngar mo rnams kyang bdag gis mid par mi nus so //
analyzed: zas mngar mo rnams kyang bdag gis mid par mi nus so //
translated: I will be unable to swallow sweet foods.

original: bdag tsha ba dang skyur ba'i zas rnams 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag tsha ba dang skyur ba'i zas rnams 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: I will crave hot and sour foods.🔽Even those rough foods will make me feel angry.

original: rtsub mo de dag rnams kyis kyang bdag gi yid rab tu khro ba skyed par byed do; ;nyin mo spyod pa'i sar ma phyin na yang lus ngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsub mo de dag rnams kyis kyang bdag gi yid rab tu khro ba skyed par byed do; ;nyin mo spyod pa'i sar ma phyin na yang lus ngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when I do not go out to my usual haunts, my body will feel tired.

original: des mthun pa sun 'don par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: des mthun pa sun 'don par byed pa'i rlung la so sor brtags par gyur pas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus so sor rig par byed do // gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: In this way, examining the wind that causes loss of appetite, he develops a correct understanding of the body.

original: rlung gzhan gang dag bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin @245a *//
analyzed: rlung gzhan gang dag bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin @245a *//
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal body will also wonder, ‘Are there any other winds inside my body?

original: na; des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: na; des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: “What is the faculty of wisdom?

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa /
translated: He sees with insight derived from hearing or through the divine eye:

analyzed: gcin lhag ma sun 'don par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung bdag gi lus la rab tu gnas pa yin te /

analyzed: de 'khrugs par gyur pa dang 'khrugs par ma gyur pa na bdag la las ci zhig byed pa yin na /

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis sam /
translated: With insight derived from hearing or

original: lha'i mig gis mthong bar gyur pa ni /

translated: through the divine eye, he sees:

original: gal te bdag gi gcin kun nas sun 'don par byed pa'i rlung rab tu 'khrugs par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi gcin kun nas sun 'don par byed pa'i rlung rab tu 'khrugs par gyur na /
translated: If the urine-residue-aggravator wind is disturbed in me,

analyzed: des nyin mo dang mtshan mo med par yang bdag gi pho mtshan la gnas pa'i tshor ba rnams rab tu zhi bar mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bdag gi dbugs 'byin pa na rdzogs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When I exhale, it will not be complete.

analyzed: de rab tu stobs che bar gyur na bdag shin tu yang skya bor skyed pa dang / rdzud par yang byed do //
